[Berühren Sie sanft ihr Gesicht.]
[Sie küssen.]
Ich habe ein wertvolles Armband in meinem Besitz. Wollt Ihr ihn?
Was tut Ihr so, um ein wenig Spaß zu haben?
Ich möchte nicht darüber reden.
[Sie sieht Euch an und lächelt.]
Kriegsherr, so sehr ich Euch auch mag, ich möchte Euch nicht küssen.
Ich bin nur einer Eurer Krieger. Bewahrt dies für Eure Männer
Jetzt gerade habe ich Spaß, da ich bei Euch bin.
Eine so wunderschöne Frau wie Ihr muss doch verheiratet sein.
Ihr seid die schönste Frau, die ich je gesehen habe.
[Berühr ihr Gesicht und küss sie.]
[Riechen Sie an ihrem Haar.]
[Halten Sie ihre Hände.]
Das wäre nett gewesen, aber wie könnte ich verheiratet gewesen sein, wenn ich mein ganzes Leben mit fliehen verbrachte?
Das denke ich nicht. Ich weiß, dass es Frauen gibt, die noch schöner sind.
Eure Lippen berühren sich
Was machst du? Verhälst dich wie ein Wolf! Verschwinde!
[Sie lächelt Euch an und errötet.]
Meine Dame, mein Zelt ist ohne Euch nur ein armseliger Palast. Ich bete dafür, dass Ihr mich für würdig haltet ihn zu verherrlichen
Wartet auf mich bis es im ganzen Lager ruhig geworden ist. Ich werde da sein, mein Liebster.
[Morrigan zwinkert während sie dich wissentlich anlächelt. Du erkennst, dass sie in dich verliebt ist.]
Tut mir leid, ich habe noch Anderes zu tun.
Was könnt Ihr mir über Eure Fertigkeiten erzählen?
Nun gut, lasst es mich Euch sagen...
Wir müssen uns für eine Weile trennen.
(Geben Sie Ihren Männern Ringe und Armbänder im Wert von 3000 Pfennige.)
Danke, Ihr ehrt mich mit diesen Geschenken.
Gehen Sie jetzt.
Ach wirklich? Nun, ich werde hier zumindest nicht ewig warten. Ich gehe zu den Städten und suche mir andere Arbeit. Ist es dass, was Du willst?
Eigentlich gibt es da etwas, dass ich Euch sagen muss.
Das stimmt. Wir müssen uns trennen.
Nein, ich hätte Euch lieber auf meiner Seite.
Nungut. Ich ziehe dann weiter. Sucht mich wieder auf, falls Ihr mich wieder braucht.
Ich möchte Sie etwas fragen.
Macht nichts.
\nSehr gut. Was wollten Sie fragen?
Wie findest du laufen die Dinge in dieser Gruppe?
Sagen Sie mir Ihre Geschichte wieder.
I suppose you know that I aspire to be {reg59?queen:king} of this land?
Habt Ihr irgendwelche Verbindungen, die wir zu unserem Vorteil nutzen können?
Ich möchte meine Beziehungen mit einer Siedlung verbessern.
Wäret Ihr daran interessiert ein Lehen zu verwalten?
Macht nichts.
Kurze Zeit danach werde ich wieder zu Euch stoßen.
Irgendetwas anderes?
Ähm...Ja. Kam mir zu Ohren.
Würdet Ihr mein Vorhaben dann unterstützen?
Sehr gut. Ich werde das im Auge behalten.

I would, {s21}. Moreover, I have a proposal on how I might help you attain your throne. However, you recently sent {s22} off on a similar mission. Perhaps we should wait for a couple of weeks to avoid drawing too much attention to ourselves.
Sehr gut. Du machst das
Nach reiflicher Überlegung, bleibt doch bei mir für eine Weile.
Farewell then, {s21}, for a little while
Welche Siedlung haben Sie im Sinn?
Derzeit, vergesst es. Vielleicht später.
Sehr gut. Ich werde dorthin reisen und versuchen, Eure Beziehungen zu verbessern mit {s4}, {s21}.

Of course, as few people as possible should know of this. If you want to collect the information, or pull me out, then don't send a messenger. Come and get me yourself -- even if that means you have to sneak through the gates.
Hervorragender Einfall - Ihr erledigt das.
Obwohl, haltet euch erst einmal fern.
Good. I should be ready to report in about five days. Farewell then, {s21}, for a little while.
It's time, lads! Up and at them!
Halt! Ihr bringt viele Boote mit euch. Wer seid ihr, und was beabsichtigt ihr?
Mein Name ist {playername}. Seid Ihr die Armee aus Asturias´ Königreich?
My name is {playername}. I come in accordance with the agreements with West Seaxe.
My name is {playername}. I come to negotiate on behalf of the sons of Ragnar.
Ja, und wenn Sie wissen, wer wir sind, können Sie nur aus West Seaxe kommen.

I see. Well, my job is not to trust anyone, but stay alert. If your fleet moves, we will attack you. You'll go with two or three men to our ship, and we will take you to the village to talk to our leaders. Five of our men will go to your ship as hostages to guarantee your safety.
Los geht's!
Aye! Verschont mich! Verschont mein Leben! Lasst mich gehen und ich gehe weit weit weg von hier, lerne einen ehrhaften Beruf und du hörst nie wieder etwas von mir.

I'll spare your life -- but in exchange, I want information. Either you or your mates kidnapped the brother of a prominent merchant in town. Tell me where you're hiding him, and give me your word that you'll stop troubling the people of these parts, and you can go free.
Was wollt Ihr?
Nach Euch habe ich gesucht. Sagt mir sofort wo Eure Gefangenen sind und ich lasse Dich gehen.
Nicht. Wir lassen euch in Frieden.
Ha! Diese Gefangenen kommen nur frei wenn Du ihr Lösegeld bezahlst. Hast du Geld dabei?
Nein, doch ich bringe Stahl mit.
Oh bless you, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. Bless you. We've done the lad no harm. We've been keeping him in our hideout near {s9}. I'll describe the area nearby in detail, so there's no mistaking it...
Beautiful work, {playername}! Let me have my {reg33} peningas. I hope you got your fair share from the weeping men of {s33}.
Shame on you, {playername}! You are a miserable failure. You couldn't even defeat those weeping men of {s33}.
{playername}, Du hast Ihn gerettet! Vielen vielen Dank dass du meinen {s11} gerettet hast. Bitte, nimm dies als kleine Bezahlung für deine noble Geste.
Es ist mir immer eine Ehre zu dienen, {s65}.

Are you all right? Well... I guess you're alive, at any rate. I'm not sure that we can say the same for the other fellow. That's one less thief to trouble our streets at night, although Heaven knows he won't be the last... Anyway, maybe you can help me with something. Let's talk more inside. Out here, we don't know who is listening.

Hervorragende Arbeit. Ihr habt genügend Männer rekrutiert um gegen die Banditen vorzugehen. Nun, Reisende, welche {s9} betraten, berichteten uns von einer kleinen Gruppe Räuber, welche ausserhalb der Stadt lauern. Ich vermute, dass sie alle von der gleichen Bande sind, der, die meinen Bruder entführten. Jagt sie, besiegt sie und lasst Euch die Position ihres Versteckes verraten.

So, you've found out where they hid my brother? Splendid work. I flatter myself that I'm a fine judge of character, and you look to be a {reg59?woman:man} who can get things done. Now, go out and save his unworthy hide!

Well... My brother is home safe. I'm not sure what to do with him -- maybe pack him off to a university outside the Northlands. That way, if he gets knocked on the head in a street brawl, no one can say it's my fault. But that's not your problem. Here's the rest of your reward. It was well earned.
Das Geld ist stets willkommen und ich bin froh nützlich gewesen zu sein.
Gut! Und jetzt....bist Du daran interessiert etwas mehr zu machen?
Möglich. Was benötigt Ihr?

Remember how I told you that the bandits had an ally inside the walls? I think I know who it is -- the captain of the watch, no less. Some months ago, this captain, seeing the amount of profit we merchants were making from trade across the frontiers, decided to borrow some money to sponsor a caravan. Unfortunately, like many who are new to commerce, he failed to realize that great profit only comes with great risk. So he sank all his money into the most expensive commodities, and of course, his caravan was captured and looted, and he lost everything.

As a consequence, it seems, our captain turned to villainy to recoup his fortune. I supposed I'd do the same if, the Heavens forbid, I ever faced indebtedness and ruination. Now, any watch captain worth his salary will have a few thieves and robbers on his payroll, to inform on the rest, but our captain decides to employ these bastards wholesale. He brings them into the town, lets them do as they will, and takes a share of their take. You've heard of poachers turning gamekeepers? Well, in the unfortunate land of the Northlands, sometimes gamekeepers will turn poacher. Luckily, there are still a few brave, honest souls in the watch who've told me how he works.

Now -- here's my plan. I could bring this to the attention of {s4}, lord of the city, but that would mean an inquiry, my word against the captain's, and witnesses can be bought and evidence destroyed, or maybe the whole thing will be forgotten if the enemy comes across the border again, and all I'll get for my trouble is a knife in the ribs. In time of war, you see, a king's eye wanders far from his domain, and his subjects suffer. So I've got another idea. I've got a small group of townsfolk together, some men in my employ and some others who've lost relatives to these bandits, and we'll storm the captain's home and bring him in chains before {s4}, hopefully with a few captured bandits to explain how things stack up.
Alles was ich brauche, ist jemand, der meine kleine Armee in den Kampf führen kann - und mir fällt niemand besseres als Du ein. Also, was sagst du?
Woher weiß ich, dass Du mir die Wahrheit sagst?

Oh, well, I suppose it's possible that I found a dozen bandits who were willing to give their lives to give a passing stranger a false impression of life in old {s4}... Well, I guess you can't really know if my word is good, but I reckon you've learned by now that my money is good, and there's another 100 peningas, or maybe a bit more, that's waiting for you if you'll do me this last little favor. So what do you say?
Alles klar, ich werde Deine Männer führen.
Es tut mir so leid. Das ist zu schnell zu viel. Ich brauche Zeit um darüber nachzudenken.
Splendid. It's been a long time since I staked so much on a single throw of the dice, and frankly I find it exhilarating. My men are ready to move on your word. Are you ready?
Ja. Gib ihnen das Signal.
Jetzt nicht. Ich brauche zu erst eine Pause bevor ich wieder kämpfen kann.
Gut! Und jetzt - schlage hart, schlage schnell und der Kapitän und seine Begleiter werden nicht wissen was sie getroffen hat. Möge der Himmel mit Dir sein.

Right. I can keep my men standing by. If you let this go too long, then I suppose that I shall have to finish this affair without you, but I would be most pleased if you could be part of it as well. For now, take what time you need.
Sehr gut. Ich werde Banditen jagen.
Warum kommt Ihr nicht mit uns?

Because I'm paying you to go take care of it. That's the short answer. The long answer is that I've got some leads to follow up here in town, and I have just as much chance of getting knocked on my head as you, if that's what you're asking. But I respect your question. Now, what do you say?
Ich kann mich im Moment nicht darum kümmern.
In Ordnung. Ich werde jetzt das Banditenversteck angreifen und deinen Bruder retten.
Ich kann mich im Moment nicht darum kümmern.
You may do as you wish, {reg59?my lady:sir}, but I am disappointed. You would do well to reconsider. I am a rich man, and would show you my gratitude in coin.
Du bist sehr überzeugend. Ich werde dir helfen.
Du bist sehr überzeugend. Ich werde dir helfen.
Du bist sehr überzeugend. Ich werde dir helfen.
Du bist sehr überzeugend. Ich werde dir helfen.
Wie gesagt, ich habe anderswo noch wichtigere Geschäfte am laufen.
Nun -- finde und besiege die Banditengruppe.
Now -- go attack that bandit hideout, get my brother back, and show those brigands what happens to those who threaten my household.
Oh -- dem Himmel sei Dank... Bin ich in Sicherheit?

Ah... {playername}. Things didn't go quite so well as I had hoped. {s5} couldn't quite find it in him to overlook my little breach of the peace. Oh, he's grateful enough that I got rid of his crooked captain -- a guard who'll let in bandits will let in an enemy army, if the price is right -- but he can't exactly have me running around here as a lasting reminder of his failure to take care of things himself.
Das sieht kaum fair aus...

Fair? This is the Northlands, {reg59?my lady:my boy}! Kings do what they will, and the rest of us do as they must. He didn't string me up, and instead gave me time to sell my properties -- even put in a word with the other merchants that they best pay me a fair price, too. That's gracious enough, as kings go -- but he's a weak king, as they all are here, and weak kings must always look to their authority first, and justice second. I suppose I'd do the same, in his shoes.

Anyway, I wouldn't go rubbing your part in this affair in {s5}'s face -- but he's taken note of you, and decided that you're not worth hanging, and that's something to which I'll raise a glass any day of the week. He might even have work for you, further down the road. Or, you can sell your sword to one of his competitors. Anyway, I hope you've learned a bit about what it will take to stay alive in this troubled land, and I suspect that the money you've earned won't go to waste. Good luck.
Ich treffe Vorbereitungen die Stadt bald zu verlassen. Es war eine Ehre dich kennengelernt zu haben. Viel Glück.
Grüße, Fremder.
Was habt Ihr entdeckt?
It's time to pull you out. Let's leave town separately, but join me soon after.
Du leistest gute Arbeit. Bleib hier doch etwas länger.
{s11} I noticed that you have been keeping some notes about individual lords. I have annotated those with my findings.
Welches Lehen hattet Ihr im Sinn?
Schon gut. Es gibt kein Lehen, welches ich anbieten kann.
Ihr führt an.
My {reg59?lady:lord}, you have retrieved the letter!

Wait, my {reg59?lady:lord}. It's time to say farewell to the Danish and travel south to West Seaxe. We need to deliver the letter of the king of Asturias to Aethelred Aethelwulfing, king of West Seaxe and brother of Aelfred. I will finally be able to finish my mission.
Mein/e {reg59?lady:lord}, warte einen Moment bevor wir zum dänischen Camp gehen.
Viel Glück mit Bjorn.

You send me to my death, my friend, but I do not blame you. I understand that you want to rescue your mother. I regret only two things: failing my king and leaving his letter in the hands of his enemies and not having obtained your fidelity when I had the chance.

So, scum, did you think that you could turn against the Danish and not pay? It's time for someone else to take legitimate direction of this party. It is time for me, Egil, to take possession of this letter and bring it to my father, King Horik. I spent so long at your side, just to discover that you are a treacherous rat. After everything that has happened... Well, I have long doubted your skills to command an army. Now, you are going to die. This is my moment of glory.
My {reg59?lady:lord}, you must hurry to join the king. Follow me.
Sorry, das ist keine es ist nicht die richtige Zeit zum Sprechen.

My {reg59?lady:lord}, Sven's hideout was a dangerous place, but we managed to ransom Bodo. I understand you want to find your mother, but let me tell you when I was in the court of the jarl of Kennemer, I heard horrible things about Sigurd...
My {reg59?lady:lord}, we want you to know that no one blames you for what happened in the duel, and everyone still fully supports you.
Let's leave whenever you are ready.
Please do not waste any more of my time today, {reg59?lady:lord}. Perhaps we shall meet again in our travels.
An orphan came in to thank me for helping her family. You're a good person, {playername}! You've gotten me to feel less guilty and a little happier.
Hast du Adda das Geld gegeben?
You have turned back for now, but surely you remain interested in Thiaderd's hideout...
Sag mir was passiert ist, seit die Woden Ric von Sven Bull Neck angegriffen wurde.
Beruhig dich. Dein Vater, Thonkrik hat mich geschickt um dich zu finden.
Bleib dort stehen und sag mir was du willst.
Ganz ruhig! Ich bin kein Fein. Ich habe dich mit König Horik sprechen gesehen und bin dir gefolgt. Ich habe meine Hände nicht bei meinen Waffen und bin auf deine Gnade angewiesen...
Ich kann es nicht leiden, wenn mir jemand folgt.
Vielen Dank! Ich glaube, ich schulde dir mein Leben.
Thanks, but no help was needed with these men.
{s2}^^Neither do I! I'm Solveig, and I have chosen to serve you and protect you while you remain worthy.
{s2}^^They were but fools. They had been following you for days and have had a hundred better opportunities. However, any chosen time would have been a failure, because I was ready to rescue you.
{s2}^^Do not worry. I will not tell anyone that I had to rescue you when you were with your pants down.
Are you not afraid of bandits on the roads, traveling alone as you are?
Ich hätte niemals erwartet, einen Griechen hier in Northvegr zu treffen.
{s2}^^Well, I was not alone, and now I'm with you, and I'm sure the bandits will run away when they see you.
{s2}^^I had never expected to find a Norwegian in Konstantinoupolis, but there they were, busy taking me into slavery!
What are you talking about? Was it you who sent the message about my mother?
Halt dein Maul, du Abschaum! Du kennst also meine Mutter?

{s2}^^Yes, yes! She sent me to talk to you. I was with her... I mean that I was her servant, her slave, when the Danish of Sven Bull Neck took me prisoner. Sven is terrible! I was afraid. I often thought about escaping, but I was so scared that I did not even try.

{s2}^^I was the slave of your mother after the Danish captured me in East Engle little more than a month ago. She is not well, but that you already know. She is very ill; is dying. Most of the time, she does not remember who she is and says strange things. The Vikings of Sven Bull Neck think she is a seidr, someone who has spirits, and they consult her about their Fate. Sven has married her because that is believed to improve luck. He says that when he captures you, he will sacrifice you to the gods, because you have the blood of a seidr.
Ich höre.
Sven interessiert mich nicht. Erzähle mir von meiner Mutter.

Sven Bull Neck is a troubled man, and you have become his obsession for having killed his brother, a man named Olvir. Your mother predicted Olvir's death at your hands, and Sven is angry with his master, Sigurd Ragnarsson, as he was the one who sent Olvir to where you were.^^I've only known Sven a little. I heard the men say he was once a great leader, a shepherd of men. To the contrary, I saw a man who maintains loyalty through fear.

Sometimes your mother could remember and be herself. Then she would speak about you, her {reg59?daughter:son}. She said that you were destined for greatness, and that your destiny is beyond the control of the Norns that sent Sven. Only she regrets that her end is near and that she will not see you.^^She told me to flee, to find you and remind you that the happiest day of her life was when you came into the world. She also told me that if she never sees you again, she would always be by your side.
Wo ist sie?
Sie war schon immer eine schwache Frau. Wo ist Sven?

When I escaped, we were close to Grantebrycge, but that was two weeks ago, which is what it took me to find you. The last I heard was that Sven Bull Neck gathered his men and led them to their ships to be at the service of the king.
Geht er nach Douar-an-Enez?
Ich verstehe. Ich glaube, ich weiß, wohin sie gegangen sind.
Was? Ich habe keinen Schimmer, wer Douar ist. Pass auf, ich kann hier nicht bleiben. Deine Mutter hat mich gebeten, dass ich mich um dich kümmere, also komme ich mit dir mit.
That is great! Listen. I can't remain here. Your mother asked me to take care of you, so I'm going with you.
I've had to kill a companion and join a war fleet. Now I must take a judge along?
I supposed that the Assembly would send someone. I did not think it would be you.
A doctor, eh? Yes, you are welcome. Let's get on track and join the Viking fleet.

{s2}^^The Assembly decided I join you, but I am happy to carry it out. It is not my intention to control you, but I must ensure that you join the fleet and come to Englaland. From that moment on, I would like you to see me as a companion, as the doctor your men need.
I've had to kill a companion and join a war fleet. Now I must take a judge along?
I guess I have no choice. Let's get on track and join the Viking fleet.

{s2}^^I understand that things have not been easy, but the Assembly is the law. It is what keeps the balance in every part of Danmark and even in the whole kingdom. What do you think would have happened without the jurisdiction of the Assembly? Possibly a war between the King Horik and Jarl Sigurd? Who knows, this may still occur despite the Assembly. It would not be the first time. Honor and truth are very important in Danmark, and there are only two ways to satisfy their requirements: with wergild or blood. The line between friendship and hatred between two neighbors sharing the land is very thin. If the Assembly did not exist, hundreds of men would die every day for the slightest of complaints.
The Assembly was not fair to me, whatever good there is in avoiding a war.
That is fine. Let's get on track and join the Viking fleet.

{s2}^^Assembly decisions cannot please everyone. Dare I say, sometimes the judgments of the Assembly are not meant to be fair. Its mission is to maintain order and balance, ensuring that men come to the Assembly to settle disputes instead of killing each other.
Let's get on track and join the Viking fleet.
I'm sure we will be good friends. We must go to the port of Ribe as soon as you can and ask the port master to join the fleet.
Wie bist du hier hergekommen?
Bodo...hat sonst noch irgendjemand den Angriff der Vikinger überlebt?
Friese has not treated me well either, especially the jarl of Kennemer. I'm leaving this land, and you're coming with me.
Take another drink and tell me why you should not be here, Reginhard.
Noch bist du nicht tot. Ich werde dich später retten.
Viel Glück Bodo. Es war sehr interessant mit dir zu reisen.
Ich habe dich nie an meiner Seite gewollt, Scitte.
I think that rescue won't be possible, but thank you for the kind thought. I hope we meet in the afterlife. Now go and rescue your mother, my friend.
(You watch as Sigurd's men drag Bodo away. The Cantabrian turns his head back once to look at you before accepting his fate.)
{s2}^^Damn! These Vikings have broken the seal. Fortunately, the letter of King Aldefonso was encrypted. I hope that the Vikings were not able to solve the mystery.

{s2}^^When you gave me to Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye,' I thought it was my end. I would die disgraced for having brought death to the Woden Ric and for not being able to fulfill the mission of my king. Fortunately for me, the letter of King Aldefonso was encrypted, so I'm still alive. The Vikings were not able to solve the mystery and brought me here to torture and tell them the code before the Assembly. The Vikings are not imaginative with torture, but they are brutal. I think if you had not come, I would not have endured much longer alive.
I'm sorry for having given you to Sigurd, my friend. I'm glad to have you back.
Ich dachte, dass Sigurd dich töten würde. Ich sehe, dass du härter bist als ich dachte.
--du versuchst den Brief zu lesen--
--You don't know how to read, so you cannot understand it. Give the letter to Bodo.--
Erzähl mir von diesem Brief, Bodo. Weshalb ist er so wichtig?

{s2}^^Do not worry. I am aware of the pressure that you feel on your shoulders and of the concern that you have for the life of your mother. What matters now is that we are together and we have the letter.

Fortunately, they needed me to decrypt the document. If I had given them what they wanted, I would have been dead long ago. Well, I do not want to think about this. Now we're back together and have the letter.
--You open the parchment carefully, avoiding touching Atli's bloodstains with your fingers. You try reading the letter.--
--You don't know how to read, so you cannot understand it. Give the letter to Bodo.--
Erzähl mir von diesem Brief, Bodo. Weshalb ist er so wichtig?
--The text is Latin, and it talks about Noah and his ark, with many comments by a monk, but nothing that would appear relevant.--
This letter is important and can change everything, but I need your help to finish my mission. It's time to reveal its secrets...
The trick is to read the first word after each period in the first three lines of each paragraph and read the last words before the period in the following.

{s2}^^Aldefonso became king very recently, after inheriting the throne of his father. He explains at the beginning of this letter that he respects the North and continues the covenants of his father. He sends a messenger to West Seaxe -- me -- and another to Frankia. The North Sea, he says, should be made safe and the Vikings eradicated. West Seaxe is the best place from which to do this, given its proximity to Danmark.
Why would the Kingdom of Asturias be worried about the Vikings?
Komm auf den Punkt, Bodo.

{s2}^^My king, Aldefonso, is particularly concerned about the Danish, who are the ones who led the raids on his kingdom in the past. There were two particularly worrying attacks, which King Aldefonso does not want repeated. The first was about twenty-four years ago, during the reign of King Ranimiro, Aldefonso's grandfather, when the Vikings were seen near to Asturias coast with more than 120 ships and 3000 men. Ranimiro quickly gathered his men in Cantabria and Asturias and sent messages to come to Gallaecia, where the Vikings landed to cause damage. Ranimiro was a warrior king. When the Vikings arrived, he was firmly entrenched in a stronghold, so he was able to defeat them in battle and burn 70 ships.

All the same, another big Viking expedition came ten years ago, in the time of King Ordonio, the father of the current king. The fleet of almost 100 ships was led by Bjorn Ironside and Haesten, Ragnar's sons. They disembarked in Gallaecia, near the tomb of Santiago, and caused much damage before they were expelled. After this King Ordonio began contacting other kingdoms in the North that had been attacked by Vikings, too, especially Frankia and West Seaxe. This letter is the finale to years of diplomatic efforts.

The letter says that according to what was promised by his father, Aldefonso agrees to send 20 ships and 600 men to West Seaxe. The men are all veterans of the Muslim wars, fully equipped with chain mail, sword, spear and shield. These men, joining West Seaxe with contributions from Frankia, will cleanse the sea of Vikings. The letter details the route and the ports these men will use on their journey to West Seaxe and asks the very noble king, Aethelred of the Seaxna, to prepare accommodation and food for them. Do you see the importance of this letter, and why Sigurd Ragnarsson, or any Viking leader, for that matter, would want to intercept it?
This alliance may harm the interests of the Danish and their way of life.
Six hundred veteran men would allow West Seaxe to conquer other kingdoms.
I'd rather you tell me.
Honestly, I do not care. Now that we have the letter, it's time to go back to King Horik.
No, you are not listening to me. This army is not to be used for conquering. It is an alliance with one objective: cleanse the North Sea of Vikings. Allow me to explain.

Figure that 600 veteran men from each kingdom make 1800 soldiers whose sole purpose is to finish the Vikings. We're not talking about a peasant levy but about professional warriors, well trained and well equipped. This is a huge economic burden for any one kingdom, but if they are well led -- King Aethelred's brother, Aelfred, was chosen for this -- it could free the North Sea of the tempest that now whips it. Therefore, the letter is important to my mission, so Sigurd Ragnarsson made every effort to intercept it. If he can show the letter in the Assembly and so demonstrate the danger that it portends for all of them, the Assembly will make him king with the mission of preventing this alliance.
Then I will give the letter to King Horik, so it will be he who will lead the Danish.
Fine. In that case, I'll give the letter to West Seaxe.
I need to see what the Assembly decides. Then I will decide. Save it for now.
This letter is a powerful weapon. Keep it safe.

If you give this letter to King Horik or any other Norseman, he will use it to gain power and then destroy all that my kings have fought for over the years. I understand that your concerns now are the Assembly and your mother. I'll help you with that now. Later we will discuss the letter again.
Fine, but don't think I'll change my mind. I will certainly give it to the Vikings.
Fine, but don't think I'll change my mind. I will certainly give it to West Seaxe.
Meinetwegen, reden wir später über den Brief.

Well, we will tell King Horik that the letter was destroyed during the fight with Atli Eiriksson. Then he does not have to worry about Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' using it in the Assembly. This will ensure his support for your cause.
Let's not waste any more time but get out of this cave.

Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' was in the mead hall of the jarl of Kennemer on more than one occasion. He is not just any man, my {reg59?lady:lord}! You know that the jarl of Kennemer is a hard man, but he trembled before Sigurd. Sigurd doesn't say a lot, he never smiles, and his snake eyes burrow into you as if he were trying to read your thoughts. I was but a slave, but I heard things. People say that he is the most dangerous of the sons of Ragnar, a man who would kill you just for coughing nearby or for being in his way on the wrong day.
The beautiful Brunhild is right, {playername}. From what I know, Sigurd Ragnarsson is the kind of man that one should avoid. Unfortunately, he blocks our way...

I don't believe it is so bad. You can't trust the jarl of Kennemer, since he is an accomplished actor who uses every possible tool to try to manipulate others. If he saw an advantage in passing as timid before Sigurd, he would've done that. I would be very careful with him, as he's a man who smiles when you face him, and stabs you with a dagger when you turn. With Sigurd, at least, you always know where he is coming from.
Reginhard is talking without knowing him. I've heard things and seen things. Maybe Reginhard was too busy drinking or betraying someone. Sigurd is spiteful, never forgiving -- and never forgetting...
You have the gall, woman, to call me a drunk and traitor to my face! You know nothing about me! Watch your words, or you will have to watch your back.
Brunhild! Reginhard has had a hard life. Don't use what happened to Thiaderd against him.
Reginhard! Overcome your regrets and your past and never threaten a member of this party.
Am I with grown people or children? Silence both you, now! Bodo, what do you think?
Bodo, can you give me some advice about Sigurd?
I'm sorry, my {reg59?lady:lord}. I'm sorry, Reginhard. I let my temper get the best of me.
Yes, I see how things work now. I withdraw my threats, but she should watch her words.
We are at crossroads. Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' has what we need, and your mother's life is in danger. In my opinion, we should go and talk to him, even if it costs us our lives. We have no choice...
Maybe there is another way. There is a powerful man who hates Sigurd: King Horik Gottfredsson of Danmark, Sigurd's king.
Warum hasst sein König ihn, Brunhild?
Imagine what you propose. If you were to speak to King Horik, what would you say?
Well, I know only what I've heard. They are enemies. Maybe Sigurd wants to be king himself.
Sigurd would be stupid, then. King Horik could banish him, make him an outcast, and strip him of his lands by denouncing him for the slightest infraction at the Thing.
My knowledge is limited, but perhaps Sigurd is as powerful as the king himself. Or maybe King Horik doesn't want more wars in Danmark, after getting his throne after a long war with the other jarls.
Reginhard, what is this 'thing' you speak of?
Speak with Sigurd or tell King Horik? We have a difficult decision to make.
The Thing or the Assembly is a meeting of free men where disputes are solved and political decisions are made.

I think we should get the protection and support of King Horik. This will give us an advantage when talking to Sigurd and will force him to respect our lives. If King Horik helps us, you can legally claim your mother back.
Do not go straight to Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' now. It may cause the death of your mother, and perhaps you will lose track of Sven Bull Neck forever. Why not see whether King Horik will support us?

If I had to choose between going straight to Sigurd and getting myself killed or going to Horik and getting your mother killed, I wouldn't know what to say. You got me out of the hole where I was, so I'm fine with your choice whatever it is.
I need to think about it. Thank you, all. We have to continue our travels.

Sven Bull Neck came here after the attack. He left some of his men here with us, the prisoners. I also saw him sending ships on a mission to attack Friese. Then he went north. I think something or someone called him there. Rather, I have heard his men say this, but not everything they say is true.
I know you really want to ask if your mother is still alive, and where she is. Well, I have not told you everything. I need you to stay calm and listen to me carefully.
{s2}^^Sven Bull Neck didn't end up there by chance. Our boat was his goal, and we had a traitor on board...
What are you saying? What purpose? What traitor?
I could care less about all you have to say. I want to know what happened to my mother.
{s2}^^I told you to remain calm! I'll get to that shortly, but you should know this first...

{s2}^^What happened was my fault, {playername}. I was Sven Bull Neck's target, so we were attacked and so on. I commended my soul to Erudino, for I was willing to die, but the Vikings wanted me alive. Therefore, it was I who brought death to my family on the boat. My redemption is that Sven Bull Neck will die at my hands.
Also warst DU der Verräter?
This is all your fault. You have destroyed my life.
No, Sven Bull Neck is mine, and I will kill you if you cross my path.
{s2}^^You're not listening to me! I was the Sven's target. How can I betray myself?
{s2}^^I know, and I'm so sorry.
{s2}^^This is not the issue to deal with now... but I promised Erudino.

I was stupid. I believed that the Woden Ric was safe, but I was wrong. I was betrayed by its captain. The poor man thought that Sven Bull Neck would give him wealth. He was cheated, for, when the Vikings raided the Woden Ric, he was killed. Maybe that is the real reason why we stopped among those shipwrecks...
The Woden Ric captain betrayed me -- indeed, all of us -- but I do not begrudge him that. He was just an idiot, and this cost him his life.
He is lucky to be dead, because I would kill him myself. I hate traitors.
But why was Sven Bull Neck chasing you? Why were YOU his goal?
I'm still waiting to hear about my mother.
{s2}^^Little can be done in this regard.

I was Sven Bull Neck's target, as I had something very important in my hands, something so important that his lord, Sigurd Ragnarson, would kill for it. However, I myself did something terrible before the Viking assault, something I regret.

Your mother is alive. When I awoke, a prisoner on Sven Bull Neck's ship, your mother was next to me. We were the only survivors, or so I thought until you came to my rescue today. Your mother thinks you are dead, my friend.
What did you do?

I gave it to your mother! I thought that it was safer in her hands than in mine... Before you take any fatal action against me in justified anger, you should know that it saved her life, because the Vikings thought she was my master.

Do you understand? If not for that object, she probably would be dead now, like the rest of the people of the Woden Ric. Your mother's disease helped too, because the Vikings think that madness is a touch of the gods. Sven took your mother north with him and left me to my fate here, to be sold as a slave, because he thought she was my master and the object carrier. We must hurry, because when Sven Bull Neck discovers the truth, he will kill her.
Who are you, really, and what is so important to be so wanted by Sven and his lord, Sigurd?
Wo hat er meine Mutter hingebracht?

That's not important, but I will tell you that I'm not a common traveler. I was sent by the king of Asturias, and what I brought with me is a gift that could change the course of a war! We'll talk about this later. It is urgent now to find your mother. Sven Bull Neck was summoned by his lord, Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' Ragnarsson. Sigurd wants this object badly. He will interrogate your mother about it, because he thinks she has the information he needs. We must find Sigurd soon.

Sven Bull Neck was summoned by his lord, Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' Ragnarsson. Sigurd wants this object badly. He will interrogate your mother about it, because he thinks she has the information he needs. We must find Sigurd soon.
{s2}^^I am not sure that we have anything to talk about.
Alright, I will stay with you, but tell me why you should not be here.
Come on, Reginhard, I'm legitimate. Tell me why you should not be here.
Reginhard, take these 50 peningas. I know that times are bad and friends should help.
You're such an interesting person. What is your story? (Persuasion)

{s2}^^When my family died, I joined the rebels, tough and brave men who struggle to free us from the oppression of the Danish. I fought at their side, and I was happy because being with them, always busy and fearing death, made me forget what happened to my family.
Why are you no longer with them?
What can you tell me about your leader?
How can I find them?
You cannot find them. They do not want to be found. These men fear the jarl. Thiaderd only allows people he trusts to join.
I am trustworthy. Ask me anything you want.
I think you're playing with me, and I do not like it. I'm leaving.

{s3}^^Look at me and listen. There are many people having a hard time during this rebellion, particularly the many widows and orphans. There is a woman in Dorestad who collects donations to care for these widows and orphans. Go see her and help. I think you're a good person, but show me. Talk to this woman. Her name is Adda. You can find her in the shop on the wharf. Make a donation in my name. Maybe this will help my people see me with different eyes.
Bodo, remind me about your mission.
Yes, I was thinking about the letter, and I've made a decision.

Your memory is fragile, my friend. When we traveled in the Woden Ric, Sven Bull Neck attacked us to steal a letter that I had. That's where our history began. Sven stole the letter for Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye,' his jarl, but we recovered the letter in Northvegr. We pulled it from the hands of the corpse of Atli, the man whom Sigurd had ordered to protect the letter. Now the letter is in our possession, and we were waiting for the right time to take it to West Seaxe. This time has come.

I am very happy! Without you, I would not have gotten this far. The letter will coordinate the alliance between West Seaxe, Asturias and the Franks. These three kingdoms will gather together men and ships to cleanse the North Sea of Vikings. In fact, it is possible that the fleet of Asturias is about to be sent, because my mission has been delayed.
I would like to hear the opinions of my other companions before making a decision.
Nun, vernehmt meine Entscheidung.
{playername}, ich schätze ihr solltet euch unseren Rat anhören, bevor ihr entscheidet.
Natürlich.
Nein, der Anführer bin ich, und ich brauche euren Rat nicht.
Ich habe nichts weiter zu sagen. Ich werde auch die anderen anhören.
Ich stimme dem, was {playername} sagt bei, was es auch ist.
--Er räuspert sich um die allgemeine Aufmerksamkeit zu erringen.--

Sorry, but I can't be impartial in this matter. My ancestors, my family, are Vikings. The gods have granted us victory upon victory, so that we may acquire fame and wealth. This invasion we have embarked upon is in the footsteps of the sons of Ragnar in Englaland. It is a rich, fertile land worth fighting for. The Danish understand that if you can seize something, it's yours. It is for the inhabitants of the land to defend it and be worthy adversaries.

The Danish are not beggars, and do not come asking for a piece of land. Danes do not ask for charity from the Saxons. We come with weapons in hand, ready to fight. If the Angles or Saxons defeat us, we will respect their victory, but if we prevail, the gods are with us and the fertile soil belongs to us. That is what I believe. If the Saxons and Franks come northward to fight and defeat the Danish, they are true warriors and the land is theirs.
Euer Rat wird mich bei meiner Entscheidung sicherlich beeinflussen, Asbjorn. Dank sei euch.
This does not clarify anything.
All men have the right to live without having to worry about what the sea may bring.
I've said all I have to say. You have my support, whatever you decide. It doesn't matter anyway, as fate has already been written.
Whatever you decide, I'm taking my leave and going back to Odinsve. I've made good friends in this party, but I know that now we'll be at odds. Therefore, I leave while we are still all friends.

I am not as good as Asbjorn at speaking. I'm just a slave who escaped from the hands of a Danish jarl. You know what I think about the Danish, or rather certain Danes who occupy Kennemer. They come, kill and take what they want. If delivering the letter to West Seaxe means a safer North Sea, you have my support. If you deliver the letter to the Danish, on the other hand...
Your opinion evens my decision, Brunhild.
What? What would you do if I carry the letter to the Danish?
I'll stay by your side, even though I do not like your decision. I owe you too much and have spent too much time with you to do otherwise.
I will take another direction. I will not be part of what happens.
Well... well I do not know what to say. I'm fine here. I think I'll stay with you, choose what you want.
I'm not happy here. I'm sorry, but I must leave and find another person to follow.
You are very important to this group, Agathinos. I want you to follow us.
I see. We'll be better off without you.
{s2}^^Great! Then I'll stay.

It is my turn to speak. I have chosen you. I have followed you. I have fought beside you. Therefore, I think I know you better than most, {playername}. I am from Northvegr. We fought against the Danes often, and many other times we drank and laughed with them. They are like us: free men who choose to live out their fate. In Danmark or Northvegr, we have laws, but Englaland does not belong to anyone that matters. They are weak kingdoms with much wealth for the taking. You cannot put a treasure in plain sight of a man, not protect it and simply hope that he does not take it. If you're an idiot, why is it his fault?
Strength and Chaos? I love your idea, too, Solveig.
Rule by force is not fair and just brings chaos.
Chaos is good. I'll keep at your side no matter what happens. Too many things unite us.
Chaos is good. Sorry, but I don't fight against free men who have merely chosen to be Vikings.
{s2}^^I'm worried about all this. I thought you were on my side. We were to go to the king of West Seaxe together, but now I do not know. I sense doubt...
I have no doubt, Bodo. We will go together to the king of West Seaxe.
I have decided to give the letter to Rathbarth and the rest of Ragnar's sons.
{s2}^^I knew you would not fail me. Well, we must go to the king of West Seaxe as soon as possible!

--His face goes from bewilderment to uncontrolled fury.--^^What? Traitor! I trusted you, I considered you a friend, a brother. Not only have you failed me, but you're encouraging our enemies. After all we've been through, Sigurd and Sven triumph. Well, I will not stay idle. Farewell, {playername}, and hope we do not meet again... for your sake.

{s2}^^What? Traitor! I trusted you. We have our differences and do not always get along, but I thought you'd honor your word. Not only have you failed me, but you're encouraging our enemies. After all we've been through, Sigurd and Sven triumph. Well, I will not stay idle. Farewell, {playername}, and hope we do not meet again... for your sake.
As I say, the Norns weave the threads at will.
I guess this is farewell. I will be with my family, in Odinsve. Maybe in the future we see each other. I respect your decision, and I leave without rancor.
Nun ... Nun, ich bin bei euch.
I'm not happy here, you know. I'm leaving. I think it is time to return to Konstantinoupolis.
You put me between a rock and a hard place, but I gave my word, and I will keep it. I follow you.

Sorry, but I don't fight against free men who have merely chosen to be Vikings. I said it, and I stand by it. It's time to find a new master. I hope you are treated well in West Seaxe, {reg59?my pretty:handsome}.
I think you're wrong, but I'm loyal to you and follow you wherever you go.
Our paths diverge, {playername}. Good luck. If you ever go through Friese, you might find me in my father's house... or maybe not.
Nun ... Nun, ich bin bei euch.
I'm not happy here, you know. I'm leaving. I think it is time to return to Konstantinoupolis.
It's time to get back on track. We have a mission underway.
Ragnar's sons are in a difficult situation. Besieged by the Saxons, they can easily be destroyed. We need to talk about this.
That would end the Danish invasion. Then the alliance would not be necessary, right?
Sehr gut. Ich werde euch zuhören.
Yes, in part, but Danish attacks and Vikings raids have roots deeper than this one siege. Let me explain.

If you remember, {playername}, my king wants to put a stop to all the Vikings raids and safeguard his kingdom. Even if the Saxons may now force the sons of Ragnar locked in Snotingaham to surrender or kill them, there would still be other sons of Ragnar and other Danish men whose greed knows no limits. Perhaps the Saxons will get a few years of peace, adopt again old enmities with the Mercians, and forget about their alliance with the Franks and Asturians. Even so, the Danish would remain in Northhymbre, and Vikings would still infest the seas. After a few years, another leader would raise an army and would start this raiding and piracy all over again.
I think what you really fear is that the Saxons can do it without Asturias' help.
I think you're exaggerating. Gaed a wyrd swa hio scel!
The Saxons could also very well attack Northhymbre and push out the Danish.
I think the Danish will defeat the Saxons in Snotingaham and then continue south.
\nWas bekommen Sie, Bodo?

You are clever, and you know me better than I thought, {playername}. My mission over the years has been to create and strengthen this alliance. Certainly, it affects me if that breaks. However, I want you to understand the full seriousness of this situation. I do not think I would exaggerate to call this a historical moment.
You've been in Danmark with me. Do you really believe your words? The Danish will send more men next year, and the year after.
Yes, this could happen... The Danish are people who stand up to the difficulties they face.
I ask you not to give my diplomatic letter to the Saxons just yet. First, we must resolve this siege situation, avoiding a battle if possible, because that would hurt my mission.
Honestly, without reinforcements, the Danish cannot be interested in fighting right now.
I am not sure what to do with the letter. Calm down.
I'll give it to the Saxons when I see fit.
I'll give it to the Danish when I see fit.
Do not worry, Bodo. I will follow your advice.
Yes, I think so, too, but I wanted to talk to you now.
When the time comes, we'll talk about this issue. Not now.
Well, I will not keep you any longer. Go see Bjorn Ironside Ragnarsson.
What happened was inevitable, my friend. It was him or you.

I understand the weight you carry on your shoulders, because I just experienced the same, after the massacre on the Woden Ric. I know no words can soothe you, but nobody expected Reginhard's betrayal. None of this is your fault.
Vielen Dank für Ihre Worte, aber keine Sorge. Es geht mir gut.
He deserved to die, and I'm not sorry.
I killed him... I do not think I can ever forgive myself. I'm a terrible person.
It seems that we should not worry about you; you are a person without feelings.
This isn't necessary. I thought you were someone strong, with fortitude.
{s2}^^Ignore him. He does not know how hard it can be.

{s2}^^My God, my God, I... I'm guilty, and I don't understand why you've forgiven me. I let Sigurd lie to me. I thought it was an opportunity to be happy with a house and a wife. So I blamed you for the death of Thiaderd, but the fault is really mine. I started it all when I betrayed him to the jarl of Kennemer. Everything I do, I do wrong, and now Egil is dead because of me. I deserve to die. Please kill me.

{s2}^^I do not understand all the tears. Reginhard betrayed us. I trusted him. Everybody trusted him. I thought he was a good guy, and what he did was spy for Sigurd. He sold us out for a house and a woman. Reginhard was a piece of shit and deserved his death.
Reginhard betrayed us. I trusted him. Everybody trusted him, but all he did was spy for Sigurd.
True, Reginhard was a piece of shit and deserved his death.
Nein, er war ein verzweifelter Mann, der alles verloren hatte.
The piece of shit is you, and I want you out of my party now. Go back to your father.
I'm glad you think the same. For a moment, I doubted your ability to lead us. We are traveling to a dangerous place, and we need you well. Now we can go on our way.
Desperate or not, he is a traitor. It is not worth spending another word on him. Let's go on our way.

{s2}^^Oh, to be sure, you won't! This is the best news I could have heard! I leave your pathetic little company to return to a true leader, a king, my father, Horik. I now leave you, save for my hope that they kill you in Englaland.
You are guilty, Reginhard. I spare your life, but get out of my sight forever.
Yes, you are guilty, and I'll grant your wish to die. --You kill Reginhard--.
Sigurd deceived you. It's not your fault. I have forgiven you.--.

Thank you for respecting my life. I understand your decision. If I may say so, you're a Soguligr, someone worth giving material to in the sagas. I hope someday in the future we can meet as friends, forget the bad and remember all the good from the time we spent together.^^{s2}

{s2}^^Thank you for respecting my life and forgiving me. This will never happen again. I will be faithful to you above all men. My life belongs to you. If I may say so, you're a Soguligr, someone worth giving material to in the sagas.
I am a trustworthy person, as you can see. Now, where are Thiaderd and his men hiding?

{s2}^^I betrayed them, so I'm here drowning my sorrows in mead. They were my brothers, my friend. I sold one of my brothers to the jarl of Kennemer for money! I sold Thiedold, our leader's brother. Now they want to kill me, and I am awaiting my death as a betrayer. Damn that day I fell for the jarl! Damned jarl!

Thiaderd? Don't you know him? I cannot describe in words what kind of a person he is. The men would die for him, it is true. The Danish are afraid because they know that someday Thiaderd will raise an army of Frisians and throw them out of our land.
Why? This is a secret I'm not willing to reveal.
Nun, ich wünsche ihnen beizutreten. Ich bin ein Rebell!
I have a business proposal for Thiaderd. I'll pay 300 peningas to tell me where they are.
Your secrets shall be my secrets, even if I have to beat them out of you. (Power Strike)
If we talk to Thiaderd about this, surely they will understand and forgive you. (Persuasion)
Well, I understand. Let me return later with more money -- 300 peningas, for example.
They do not accept anyone they do not know.
Well, you seem to be a good person. I will take the money and join you, for I need to talk to him, too. Thiaderd is a man who values strength, so I suggest you bring your men.
{s2}^^Thank you, {playername}. You are right. I need to talk to them. I will join you. Thiaderd's hideout is in the mountains in the east. Let me show you the way.

{s2}^^You may be a joker, {playername}, but you are right. No secrets between us! Also, I need to talk to them and tell them that the jarl lied to me. I would rather die than continue here. I will join you. Thiaderd's hideout is in the mountains in the East. Let me show you the way.
Bitte! Lasst uns anfangen.
I guess we need a guide to the hideout, but then you might abandon us there.
My relationship with King Horik is... delicate. Taking you with me could cause me problems.

No, you misunderstand me. I serve King Horik, and when you talked to the king, I asked him to let me go with you. I need to make a name and gain reputation, and you need someone who can back you up with the king.
No, there's no place for you in my party.
Nun, können Sie kämpfen?

Ich sehe, du verstehst garnichts und das macht Alles komplizierter. König Horik möchte, dass ich mit dir gehe und er ist der König dieser Lande. Du musst seinen Wünschen gehorchen. Während du in Dänemark bist, werde ich für dich da sein. Aber wenn irgendwas mit mir passiert, wirst du Ärger mit König Horik haben.
I see. He wants to have a spy among my men. I hope you know at least how to fight.
Dein Vater möchte dich soweit wie möglich entfernt von dem Jarl wissen und ich verstehe warum. Du bist willkommen.
Unglücklicherweise kann ich niemanden mehr aufnehmen.
Unglücklicherweise kann ich niemanden mehr aufnehmen.
Sorry. I can't afford that at the moment.
Wir treffen uns wieder.
Was habt Ihr erlebt seit unserem letzten Treffen.
Guten Tag Ihnen.
Ja?
Verzeiht, falls ich unhöflich war. Wie war deine Geschichte nochmal?
Macht nichts.
I might be able to use you in my company.
I'll let you know if I hear of anything.
Good! Give me a few moments to prepare and I'll be ready to move.
My offer to rejoin you still stands, if you need me.

It is good to see you alive, {s5}! {s6}, and I did not know whether you had been captured, or slain, or got away. I've been roaming around since then, looking for you. Shall I get my gear together and rejoin your company?
Ich bin gekommen, um Sie hier raus zu holen.
Dank dem Himmel, Ihr seid da. Aber wie auch immer, ich gehe nirgendwo hin mit diesen Ketten an den Füßen. Ihr müsst euch irgendwie den Schlüssel von der Wache besorgen.
\nIch freue mich darauf, mit Ihnen zu reisen.
It is good to see you, {s21}! To tell you the truth, I had hoped to run into you.
{s5}. Would you want me to rejoin your shield wall?
\nWillkommen zurück, mein Freund!
Sorry, I can't take on anyone else right now.
Well... Look me up if you change your mind, eh?
Also ... Willst du mich noch zurück?

There is a matter that needs your attention. The quarrel between {s11} and {s12} has escalated to the point where it has become unseemly. If you do intervene, you risk offending one of the lords. However, if you do nothing, you risk appearing weak. Such are the burdens of kingship, {reg59?my lady:sire}.

{s1} currently does not have a lord. You may wish to keep it this way, as lords will sometimes gravitate towards lieges who have land to offer, but for the time being, no one is collecting any of its rents.

At this point, there are no particularly urgent matters that need your attention. I should point out though, sire, that I am not very skilled in the ways of politics, and that I am anxious to return to private life. If you wish to issue any but the most basic directives, I suggest appointing a trusted companion in my stead. In the meantime, is there anything you wish done?

If I may offer you a world of advice, my {reg59?lady:lord}, it seems that your right to rule as an independent monarch is not sufficiently recognized, and this may bring us problems further down the road. It may be advisable to find another kingdom with whom you have shared interests and seek its recognition, to establish yourself as an equal with the Northlands's other kings.
At this point, there are no particularly urgent matters that need your attention. Is there anything you wish done?
Is there anything you wish done?
Do you have any ideas on how to strengthen our kingdom's unity?
I have acquired everything for {s4}'s gift.
Ah, let me take those. I hope that this will mend the quarrel between you two. You may wish to speak to {reg4?her:him}, and see if I had any success.
Let's abandon our plan to {s10}.
Are you sure you want to drop that idea?
Yes, I am sure. Let's abandon that idea.
Actually, never mind.
I wish to dispatch an emissary.
I wish to indict a disloyal vassal for treason.
I wish to replace {s4} as marshal.
Ich möchte ein neues marshall ernennen.
You have just made such an appointment, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. If you countermand your decree so soon, there will be great confusion. We will need to wait a few days.
I want to reward you for your work as my advisor.
Thank you, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. What do you have in mind?
These bracelets and rings worth 2500 peningas.
I'll buy some slaves worth 5,000 peningas to help you with your tasks.
A beautiful estate valued at 10,000 peningas with a tenant who will pay you rent.
Oh, nothing. Let's get back to our tasks.
Thank you so much, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. I am happy to be at your service and now will be even more zealous in my duties.
Give me a report on the kingdom.
But of course, {reg59?my lady:sire}. I have it ready to present.
Ich möchte eine Nachricht verschicken.
Certainly, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. We have a messenger ready at your disposal. To whom would you like to send the message? I've heard the following are nearby:
Nichts davon. Später vielleicht.
Very well. What do you wish to say?
Let me check my kingdom stock.
I wish to change the tax rate in my lands.
{reg59?Lady:Lord}, remember that a high level of taxes generates distrust and can cause riots, while a low rate may deplete the treasury. What would you like to do?
Stellen Sie eine hohe Rate.
Stellen Sie eine niedrige Rate.
Set a medium rate.
Lassen Sie es wie es ist.
The tax rate is {s11} now in all of your fiefs.
I want you to hire personnel to eradicate tax losses. Make sure they intimidate even you a bit.
To hire and keep this staff will cost 3,000 peningas per week. {reg59?My lady:My lord}, you must choose whether the new staff expense is worth the additional money they will collect for you.
Ich habe entschieden. Mieten Sie das Personal.
Very well, I've thought more about it. Let's avoid the new weekly expenditure, as it's too high...
Well, {reg59?my lady:sire}. From now on, your income taxes will be higher. I guarantee it.
Dismiss the staff working on tax loss mitigation.
Dismissing this staff means tax revenues will be reduced. Are you sure?
Yes, I cannot bear seeing so many peningas flying out of our coffers.
Ah nein. Lassen Sie mich mehr darüber nachdenken.
Well, {reg59?my lady:sire}. They shall be dismissed.
Send a messenger to pay for the release of a prisoner.
Who should we pay the ransom for?^^Remember the prisoner should be in a prison so our messenger can find him.
Vergiss das.
How much ransom shall we offer? We must also add a messenger's salary of 400 peningas for the mission.
Three thousand peningas is a good number.
Eight thousand peningas would assure that the offer will be accepted.
Well, I want our subject back for sure. Offer them 15,000 peningas.
What? Even more money is necessary? Ye gods, let us think this over!
Well, a messenger will be sent to {s11} with your proposal to release {s10}.
I want a report on the piety of my subjects and new conversions.
Danke.
I want to see the kingdom's coffers.
The money in your coffers currently amounts to {reg0} peningas.^^What do you wish to do?
Add 1000 peningas to the kingdom's coffers.
Add 5000 peningas to the kingdom's coffers.
Add 10000 peningas to the kingdom's coffers.
Withdraw 1000 peningas from the kingdom's coffers.
Withdraw 5000 peningas from the kingdom's coffers.
Withdraw 10000 peningas from the kingdom's coffers.
Nichts.
How goes the war?
Tell me more about the war with the {s1}.
That's all I wanted to know. Thank you.
I'd like to discuss training of men.
I can take your recruits and turn them into warriors.
I need some men in the garrison to be trained.
Stop training men here.
Macht nichts.
Wollen Sie, dass ich eine alternative Förderung in Betracht ziehe, wenn diese verfügbar wird?
Ja.
Nein.
Nun gut, ich werde die Rekruten in {s11} trainieren. Platziere die Männer die ich lehren soll am Ende der Liste in der Garnison.
Yes, my {reg59?lady:lord}?
I wish for you to retire as minister.
I wish you to rejoin my party.
I wish you to grant one of my vassals a fief.
I wish to make myself lord of {s4}.
As you wish. You shall be lord of {s4}.
That is all for now.
Who should be the new marshal?
I shall be the marshal
For a short while, we should have no marshal
Macht nichts
Whom do you wish to send this emissary to?
Unfortunately, there is no one to send right now.
{s10} of the {s11}{s14}
Macht nichts
What do you wish to tell him?
That our two kingdoms should enter into truce.
That I wish to put myself under his protection, as his vassal.
That I wish to express my goodwill, as one monarch to another.
That I declare war upon him.
Macht nichts.
It is. I wish to make war on the {s12}.
Hmm. Perhaps not.
As you command. We are now at war with the {s12}. May the heavens grant us victory.
Who shall be your emissary? You should choose the one who you trust, but who is also persuasive -- one who can negotiate without giving offense.
Actually, I can't think of anyone.
Very well -- I shall send {s11} to the {s12} to {s14}.
Yes, do that.
Actually, hold off on that.
Very good. Who will you appoint in my stead?
My wife, {s4}.
Actually, hold off on that.
Very good. {s9} is your new minister. I will rejoin you shortly.
Very good. {s9} is your new minister. It has been an honor serving you.
Which of your fiefs do you wish to grant?{s12}
Macht nichts
And whom will you choose to receive the fief?{s12}
Macht nichts.
Very well - {s2} shall receive {s1}.
Grim news, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. Who do you believe is planning to betray you?
Macht nichts.

Think carefully on this, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. If you indict {s4} for treason unjustly, you may find others becoming nervous about serving you. On the other hand, if you truly believe that {reg4?she:he} is about to betray you, then perhaps it is best to move first, to secure control of {reg4?her:his} fortresses.
I have thought long enough. Issue the indictment!
Perhaps I should wait a little longer...
It has been sent, {reg59?my lady:my lord}.
{s12}I want to have {s1} for myself. (fiefs: {s0})
{s66}, Ihr sollt {s1} für Euch haben. (Lehen: {s0})
As you wish, {reg59?my lady:sire}. {reg6?I:{reg7?You:{s11}}} will be the new {reg3?lady:lord} of {s1}.
Hmmm. Alles klar, {playername}. Ich schätze Euren Rat. {reg6?I:{reg7?You:{s11}}} wird der/die neue {reg3?lady:lord} von {s1}.
My God, My God, he's dead. We killed Thiaderd.

All right, {playername}, you've seen who the jarl is, and you know what he did. He only wants one thing -- the power -- and now he's using you to take it, as before he used me to reach my Thiaderd. For him, we are expendable tools, and the jarl of Kennemer will finish you off when you're either not useful or become dangerous, as he did with me.

The jarl of Kennemer is an ambitious and dangerous man, I admire your fortitude to bite him and help save Doccinga despite the consequences this has had. You are a good person.^^Friese can be hostile land for us now, but I'm sure we'll find our destiny elsewhere.

{reg59?My lady:Sir}, I have taken the liberty of sending a message to King Horik. I think it will be best if we have the support of some of the king's men, especially if you have any intention of killing Sven.^Well, I have not spent much time with you, but I think this could lead to a battle. I hope you will look well upon the initiative I took to invite the king's men to join us.
Yes, I think it was a good idea, Egil. Thanks.
No, I do not want you taking initiatives without asking me beforehand. Do you understand?
Egil, ask me before making a decision. I have all the information to avoid mistakes.
{s2}^^Yes, I know. I always make good decisions. I can be a leader as good as you, or better. Maybe you should let me lead this army some time.
{s2}^^Yes, I understand. You like to control everything. Well, it's your decision.
{s2}^^You're right. Forgive me. Sometimes I'm too impulsive. I do not want to jeopardize this party by my imprudence. I will consult with you about everything.
He hated you and decided to fight. He left us no choice.

{s2}^^Yes, he did not listen to me. The jarl deceived me, told me he wanted to meet Thiaderd to negotiate peace, but Thiaderd was smarter than I and told me it was a trap.^I insisted, and his brother accompanied me in secret to the meeting with the jarl. So... the Godi of the jarl sacrificed Thiaderd's brother with the Blood Eagle.
What is the Blood Eagle?
He died like a warrior. It's time to get going. The jarl of Kennemer waits for us.
He died like a warrior, but you live like a rat. Go give the news to the jarl and leave my party.
The Danish call it Blodugr Orn. They cut away all of the ribs from the spine, and then they rip out the living lungs to flap like eagle's wings.^It is horrible! I hope you never see it.
{s4}^^Then you work for the jarl of Kennemer... In the end, he got what he wanted. Wyrd bid ful araed. One cannot fight fate. Thiaderd is dead, and you are my new family.

{s4}^^Yes, I am a rat, but you aren't any better. You used me to get him. Thiaderd was a good man. His only sin was to revolt against the Danish and fight for freedom.^God forgive me! I accept my fate! Talk to your jarl. Later, when you tell me, I will leave your party. Gaed a wyrd swa hio scel!
Gaed a wyrd swa hio scel!
Fate goes ever as she shall!
I need him to find Sven Bull Neck.
I'm not interested in your opinion. See to preparing your things, for soon you'll leave.
{s2}^^There are always other ways that do not require that we submit to the will of others, but we'll talk later. A rider approaches from Doccinga.
{s2}^^I know, and my things are ready. You can kick me out anytime, but now you have other concerns. A rider approaches from Doccinga.
I did what I had to do. The jarl of Kennemer is a traitor, and I want him far from me.
If I had known I would lose all the jarl's confidence, I would have not helped Doccinga.
I do not want to talk right now, Reginhard. Excuse me.

{s2}^^I told you he is a snake. Now you are free from him, and we should leave Friese soon, as I fear that he will look for revenge. I have heard that in the Kingdom of Mierce, over the sea, they need warriors. Wyrd bid ful araed.
{s2}^^These are the words of a coward. I guess you're concerned and not thinking clearly. We'll talk later.
{s2}^^I understand. I'm by your side for what you need. Let us follow the path.
Excuse me, {s5}. There is something I need to tell you.
To tell you the truth, {s21}
Very well. You be off, then.
Perhaps I can persuade you to change your mind.
Thank you for listening to me.
Hm. When you put it like that, I suppose I can stay a while longer, see if things improve.
I'm sorry, but I don't see your point. I am leaving whether you like it or not.
Now is not the time to discuss these issues.
We hang deserters in this company.
Oh... Right... Do you mean that?
Absolutely. You leave by my command or carried out on your shield. Which shall it be?
No, actually I don't mean that. You are free to leave.
Then this is farewell. Perhaps I'll see you around, {playername}.
Hm. I suppose I'm staying, then.
Thanks, I appreciate your opinion.
I hope that it won't happen again.
Your objection is noted. Now fall back in line.
{s11} is a valuable member of this company. I don't want you picking any more fights with {reg11?her:him}.
Tell {s11} you have my support in this, and {reg11?she:he} should hold {reg11?her:his} tongue.
I don't have time for your petty dispute. Do not bother me with this again.
{s11} is a capable member of this company. I don't want you picking any more fights with {reg11?her:him}.
Tell {s11} you have my support in this, and {reg11?she:he} should hold {reg11?her:his} tongue.
I don't have time for your petty dispute. Do not bother me with this again.
Very good.
Habt Dank.
I would prefer not to discuss such things.
Erzählt mir mehr.
We don't have time to chat just now.
I prefer my companions not to bother me with such trivialities.
It has been an honour to fight for your cause, {reg65?madame:my lord}.
You will always have my loyal support, {reg65?my lady:sir}.
I will miss living this life of adventure with you, but my duties await me. Farewell for now, {playername}. I hope I'll see you again soon.
Your opinion is noted.
Well, {s21}, at last I've found you. I've been out spreading the word about your claim, and am now ready to rejoin the shield wall.
Well, {s21}, I've found you at last! {s11}. The rest of my report I submit to you in writing.
Well, {s21}, at last I've found you. I have returned from my mission to the {s31}. In general, I would say, {s14}.
In this letter, {s12} addresses you as {reg59?Lady:Lord} of the {s4}, which implies some sort of recognition that you are a sovereign and independent monarch.
In this letter, {s12} addresses you as {reg59?Lady:Lord} of {s4}, which implies some sort of recognition that you are a sovereign and independent monarch.
In his letter, {s12} merely refers to you as {playername}. {reg65?She:He} refused to acknowledge that you hold court in a former fief. This does not constitute recognition of your right to rule.

In his letter, {s12} merely refers to you as {playername}, omitting any title. This does not constitute recognition of your right to rule. {reg65?She:He} seemed nonplussed that you do not hold court anywhere.
In his letter, {s12} merely refers to you as {playername}, omitting any title. This does not constitute recognition of your right to rule.
{s12} says that your current truce should suffice.
{s12} says that he is willing to consider a truce.
{s12} says that he is unwilling to conclude a peace.
Very well. Let this truce with the {s4} be concluded.
On second thought, perhaps this is currently not in our interests.
{s12} says that you have pledged to serve another ruler.
{s12} says that he does not believe you would honor your obligations as a vassal, and suspects that your offer is just a ploy.
{s12} says that he accepts your offer of vassalage. He will give you 30 days to seek him out, in which time he will refrain from making war on you.
Tell him that I accept his terms...
Greetings, {s21}. Are you ready for me to rejoin you?
Willkommen zurück, Freund!
Unfortunately, I cannot take you back just yet.
As you wish. I will take care of some business, and try again in a few days.
There! I can see the walls of {s3} in the distance. We've made it safely. Here, take this purse of {reg3} peningas, as I promised. I hope we can travel together again someday.
Sorry, I must take care of some business, but look me up again later... [ERROR- {s51}]
My lady, I look forward to our marriage, as soon as there is an opportunity to hold a proper feast.{s12}
My lady, if you wish to marry, we can proceed to the feast at {s4} to exchange vows before the lords of the realm.
My lady, I grow tired of waiting for the lords of this realm to assemble. Come with me to {s4} exchange our vows.
My lady, I grow tired of waiting for the lords of this realm to assemble. Perhaps we should take the first opportunity to marry, in any great hall that is open to us.
My lady, I have grown tired of waiting. Let us proceed with the vows immediately.
My lady, my eyes rejoice to see you. We may proceed with the vows.
My lady, with this assembly as my witness, I vow to take you as my wife, to honor, cherish, and protect you. May the heavens bless us with health, prosperity, and children.
I vow to take you as my husband.
Haltet ein -- ich muss darüber nachdenken.
We are now husband and wife. Let the festivities commence!
Very well. You've made your point. I have nothing more to say.
Well, {reg59?my lady:sir}! Please, do not trouble yourself to rise from the ground, as I would simply have to knock you down again. I shall take your silence as an apology. Good day to you.
Very well. You've made your point. I retract what I said. I hope you have obtained satisfaction.
Hah! Not so gallant now, are we? Now trouble me no more.
Very well -- you have won. Let all those present today witness that you have defeated me, and I shall abandon my suit of {s10}. Are you satisfied, you heartless bastard?

Get up. Let all those present today witness that I have defeated you, and you are now bound to relinquish your suit of the {s10}. I will permit you one final visit, to make your farewells. After that, if you persist in attempting to see her, everyone shall know that you are a man of scant honor.
In Ordnung. Sie haben Ihren Standpunkt gemacht. Ich entschuldige mich für das, was ich tat.
Hah! You lost, {playername}, so that settles it. Be gone now.
Was wollt Ihr?
Ergebt euch! Eure Situation ist hoffnungslos!
Ich verlange eure Aufgabe im Austausch für die {s11} die sichere Rückkehr.
Ich biete eine ehrenvolle Vereinbarung, die Belagerung zu beenden. Zahlt uns einen Tribut, und wir gehen.
Nichts. Ich verlasse dich jetzt.
Kapitulation? Es ist ein Witz, richtig? Sie haben nur sehr wenige Männer, um die Festung zu stürmen.
Und ergeben? Hah! Wir können diese Mauern halten, bis wir an Altersschwäche sterben.
Ich gebe dir überhaupt nichts. Gib auf, oder bereite dich darauf vor zu sterben!
Bastard! Wir werden dich bis zum letzten Mann bekämpfen!
Sie werden freigekauft werden und Ihre Soldaten werden Leben. Ich gebe Ihnen mein Wort.
In Ordnung. Unter diesen Bedingungen biete ich Ihnen meine Kapitulation an.
Sie haben mein Wort. Sie werden nicht angegriffen werden, wenn Sie das Fort lassen.
Very well. Then we leave this fort to you. You may have won this day, but we'll meet again.
Auf keinen Fall. Ich brauche die Geiseln als Garantien.
Dann werden wir das Fort bis zum Tod verteidigen. Diese Unterredung ist beendet.
We will not fall for your plot! We shall fight to the last man!
Unser Lord würde uns niemals verzeihen, wenn wir das Angebot annehmen würden. Wir müssen kämpfen.
Well, we will leave {s12} to you in exchange for our lord. Proceed with the exchange.
Unser Lord würde uns niemals verzeihen, wenn wir das Angebot annehmen würden. Wir müssen kämpfen.
Ich habe euren Lord frei gelassen. Jetzt verlassen Sie {s12}.
Very well. Then we leave this place to you. You have won this day.
No, I have thought better of it and stay with our lord.
Then we defend this fort to the death. This parley is done.
Perhaps... we can make a financial arrangement.
Tribute? Hah! I laugh in your face. You will not get anything from here.
Zahlt oder bereitet euch auf den Tod vor!
Bastard! Wir werden dich bis zum letzten Mann bekämpfen!
I see that we have reached an agreement. I demand {s4} peningas.
All I can offer you is {s4} peningas in coins, rings, and other treasures.
I see. Then bring the treasure now, and we'll go.
Das ist ein lächerlich kleiner Betrag. Du machst dich über mich lustig und wirst das bitter bereuen.
Sehr gut.
Ich bin gekommen um euch hier raus zu holen.
Macht nichts. Nur bleiben Sie einfach nur ruhig.
Dem Himmel sei Dank! Ich weiß nicht, wie lange ich es hier noch ausgehalten hätte.

Warte, wie werden wir entkommen? Die Garnison wird uns in dem Moment angreifen, in dem wir aus der Tür treten. Ich kann versuchen, sie zurückzuhalten, aber ich sag es lieber gleich. Sie haben mir nichts anderes gegeben als wässrigen Brei und ein paar Brocken und ich bin nicht so kräftig, wie ich es sein könnte.
Bleib einfach hinter mir und versuch dich aus Kämpfen herauszuhalten.
I'll need you to grab a weapon and help me, despite your weakness.
Actually, don't get involved in this.
Let's go!{s14}
I am in your debt for freeing me, friend.
You're not going anywhere, 'friend.' You're my prisoner now.
I'll have your head on a spear for this, you bastard! Someday!
Ich könnt gehen, wohin es euch beliebt, Herr.
Habt Dank, teure/r {reg59?lady:sire}. Ich vergesse niemanden, der mir einen Dienst erwiesen hat.
Du bist jetzt mein Gefangener.
Ich ergebe mich dir.
Du hast ehrenhaft gekämpft. Es steht euch frei zu gehen.
{playername}!
Halt!
Wir werden euch bis zum bitteren Ende bekämpfen!
Wartet! Es gibt dort etwas, dass ich mit Ihnen privat besprechen muss.
Gibt es keinen Weg, diese Schlacht zu vermeiden? Ich möchte nicht mit euch kämpfen.
Nicht angreifen! Wir ergeben uns.
Ich schulde dir einen gefallen. Gut... in Ordnung. Ich werde Sie dieses eine mal gehen lassen.
Ich erwarte Ihren Rat, {Playername}.
Kenne ich dich?
Mein Name ist {Playername}. Zu Ihren Diensten.
Ich bin {Playername}. Vielleicht haben Sie von meinen Heldentaten gehört.
Ich dachte {s11} regiert {s12}.
Grüße, {Playername}!
Was war Ihre Geschichte wieder {reg65? meine Dame: Sir}?
Ich muss Ihnen etwas sagen.
Ich möchte mich eurer Sache anschließen und Ihnen dabei helfen, den Thron zu erobern
Wenn ich mit Sven Bull Neck fertig bin, werde ich mich vielleicht eurer Sache anschließen und Ihnen helfen, den Thorn zu erobern.
Ich muss nun gehen.

Are you sure you will be up to the task, {playername}? Reclaiming my throne will be no simple matter. The lords of our realm have all sworn oaths of homage to {s11}. Such oaths to a usurper are of course invalid, and we can expect some of the lords to side with us, but it will be a very tough and challenging struggle ahead.
Ich bin bereit für diesen Kampf.
Du hast Recht. Vielleicht sollte ich etwas mehr darüber nachdenken.

I have no doubt that your support for my cause is heartfelt, {playername}, and I am grateful to you for it, but I don't think we have much of a chance of success. If you can gain renown in the battlefield and make a name for yourself as a great commander, then our friends would not hesitate to join our cause, and our enemies would be wary to take up arms against us. When that time comes, I will come with you gladly. Until that time, it will be wiser not to openly challenge the usurper, {s11}.
Haven't you already taken up the cause of {s17}? You must have a very strong sense of justice, indeed. No thank you. I will not be part of your game.

{playername}, you are already oath-bound to serve {s15}. As such, I cannot allow you to take up my cause and let my enemies claim that I am but a mere puppet of the {s16}. No, if I am to have the throne of the {s17}, I must do it due to the righteousness of my cause and the support of my subjects alone. If you want to help me, you must first free yourself of your oath to {s15}.
You are a monarch in your own right, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. If you were to back me, I would be merely your puppet.

You are a capable warrior, {playername}, and I am sure with your renown as a commander, and my righteous cause, the nobles and the good people of the {s12} will flock to our support. The time is ripe for us to act! I will come with you, and together, we will topple the usurper {s11} and take the throne from his bloodied hands. But first, you must give me your oath of homage and accept me as your liege {reg65?lady:lord}.
I am ready to pledge myself to your cause, {reg3?my lady:my lord}.
Let us bide our time a little longer.
Forward, then! Our first task is to take hold of a fortress and persuade other lords to join us. You lead the way!
Farewell for now, then.
I heard that you have befriended that {s43} called {s6}. Believe me, you can't trust that man. You should end your dealings with him.
I assure you, {s65}, I am no friend of {s6}.
Glad news, {playername}. I would fear for your safety otherwise. If you do encounter {s6}, be on your guard and don't believe a word.
{s6} is an honourable man. You've no right to speak of him thus.
