Very well -- repeat after me:^The muse Calliope bore to Morpheus a son named Orpheus^Who practised minstrelsy and by his songs moved stones and trees^When his wife Eurydice died, bitten by a snake, he went down to Hades, being fain to bring her up,^He persuaded Hades to send her up with him, back to life^The god promised to do so, if on the way Orpheus would not turn round until he should be come to his own house.^But he disobeyed and turning round beheld his wife; and she turned back to the Underworld, forever lost...

Very well -- repeat after me:^Lo, praise of the prowess of people-kings^Of spear-armed Danes, in days long sped,^We have heard, and what honor the aethelings won!^Oft Scyld the Scefing from squadroned foes,^From many a tribe, the mead-bench tore, awing the earls...

Very well -- repeat after me:^A Lion was awakened from sleep by a Mouse running over his face^Rising up angrily, he caught him and was about to kill him, when the Mouse piteously entreated, saying:^If you would only spare my life, I would be sure to repay your kindness.^The Lion laughed and let him go...
'But anxious cares already seized the queen...'
'There is a distant isle...'
'The muse Calliope bore to Morpheus a son named Orpheus...'
'LO, praise of the prowess of people-kings...'
'A Lion was awakened from sleep by a Mouse running over his face...'
Pshaw... What kind of doggerel is that?

Very well. If the poem is not to your taste, then keep your money. Only, remember: with poets and with lovers, what is important is not what pleases you but what pleases your audience. If you wish to learn the poem, I am still willing to teach.
Very good -- but there are many stanzas to go. Now, listen closely...
Can you tell me anything about the eligible maidens in this realm?
About whom did you wish to know?
Just tell me the latest piece of gossip
Macht nichts
She is married to you, of course! Clearly, no one would dream that she would do anything to engender gossip.
Very interesting -- but let us speak of something else.
Very interesting -- is there any more news?
What? I'll have that miscreant face my sword.
Do you mean that? {s11} will be honor-bound to fight you, but challenging a lord to duel over a woman is seen as a bit hotheaded, even in this warlike age.
Yes -- I intend to force {s11} to relinquish his suit of {s12}
No -- I let my passions run away with me, there
As you wish. I will spread the word of your intentions, so that {s13} does not try to back out...
Do you know of any ongoing feasts?
Leb wohl.
What do you wish to know?
Can I answer any other questions for you?
Is there a place for me in the game of love?
How would a suitor meet a lady?
Having met a lady, how would the suitor woo her?
Tell me about marriage and love among the nobility of the Northlands

Nobles are an odd lot. In the Northlands, a daughter is a political asset, to be given away to a lord with whom her father wishes to make an alliance. Yet the great families of this land idealize pure love between man and woman, and I have seen many a hardened warrior weep copious tears at the doomed ardour of Gwenhwyfar and Llwch Llenlleawg in the bards' songs -- even as he made plans to break his own daughter's heart.

Fathers differ, of course. Some nobles will let their daughters choose a husband who pleases them. Others, however, feel that to allow their daughters any choice at all would be to diminish their own authority, and insist on imposing a groom whether she likes it or not.

But the majority will steer a middle course -- they will want to make the final decision about a groom, but will weigh their daughter's preferences heavily. Among other factors, a happy marriage is more likely to produce heirs, so there is still a place for courtship and for the use of skill and passion to win a lady's heart.
What if a lady and her father disagree about a suitor?
It happens sometimes that a bride elopes. This is a major blow to the father's prestige, leading to lasting enmities. Indeed, a war may be fought over a woman. Now, that is a fine topic for a song.

In the end, however, most brides will submit to their parents' choice. A noblewoman's family is everything to her, and few are brave enough to risk its disapproval for the sake of man she barely knows. She may pine for her lover, but still accept the groom -- and without tragic love, what would we have to sing about?

Of course! Lords make a great deal of lineage, but in the end, lands and money speak louder than one's ancestors. Even though you are a foreigner, if you are coming up in the world, then many parents will consider you a fine catch.

You will have to compete with many other lords of your realm, however, who will have an advantage. They have known these ladies from childhood and have been sized up as grooms by carefully discerning mothers and aunts. Some ladies may be fascinated by the stranger, yet opt for the familiar.

So know this -- you may have your heart broken. But to enter the arena of love fearing heartbreak is like entering the battlefield fearing the enemy's arrows. Be brave, and shrug off the sting of rejection, and victory may yet be yours.

Lady -- I will speak bluntly. Most of the lords of this land are looking for a demure maiden, whose skin as fair as snow -- and your skin is burnt brown by the sun. They want a maiden whose voice is soft as bells -- and your voice is hoarse from commanding men in battle. Also, although the lords of the Northlands appreciate poems about love, most also want heirs, and few women can ride and fight while with child.

However, not all lords will be so conventionally minded. We poets sing of shield maidens and of huntresses, of women who forged their own path without having sacrificed the chance for love. I would not tell you that it would be easy for you to find a devoted husband who will accept your ways, but I would not say that it is impossible.
What advantage is there in seeking a {reg59?husband:wife}?

Ah! You are quite the romantic, I see! Well, aside from the obvious benefits of love, companionship and other, em, domestic matters, to marry among the nobility brings great assets. You may forge a strong alliance with the bride's family, and a wife may also assist you in manipulating the politics of the realm to your advantage.
What's more, most of the great families of the Northlands have at some point intermarried with royalty, which would boost your own claim to rule -- should you ever choose to assert it...

Ah! You are quite the romantic, I see! Well, aside from the obvious benefits of love, companionship and other, em, domestic matters, to marry among the nobility brings great assets. You may have access to the groom's castles and properties, and be able to work with him to advance both of your standings in the realm.

Every so often, a king or great lord of the Northlands will hold a feast. In towns, they will often be accompanied by tournaments. In castles, they will be accompanied by hunts. The feasts provide a chance for the lords to repair some of the rivalries that may undermine the strength of the realm. They also provide an opportunity for families to show off their eligible daughters, and ladies will often be allowed to mingle unsupervised with the guests.

If you have the opportunity, you may attempt to pay the lady a compliment. This indicates to her that you are a potential suitor, and she will usually know if she wishes you to continue your suit. Incidentally, if you come to her fresh from having distinguished yourself in the tournament or in the hunt, then you may make a stronger first impression than otherwise.

To woo a lady takes a certain amount of time and patience, and several meetings spaced over a period of months. A lady who is interested in you will often find ways of letting you know if she wishes you to come visit her. Alternately, you may simply go and ask her father or brother for permission. If you do not have permission from her guardian, it may be possible to arrange an assignation through other means.

Having arranged an assignment, you may then attempt to charm her and win her favor. Perhaps one of the most difficult aspects of this is finding a topic of conversation. Most noblewomen lead a cloistered life, at least until they are married, and thus will have little to say that will interest you. On other hand, she will soon tire of hearing of your own deeds in the outside world.

One time-tested mode of courtship is simply to recite a popular poem, and discuss it. This way, you are both on an equal footing, and neither will have an advantage in knowledge or experience. Of course, different ladies will have different tastes in poetry.

At some point, you will be able to discuss directly the issue of marriage. She will then let you know if you measure up to what she wants in a husband. Some ladies will coolly assess who is the most prestigious of her suitors, while others will be guided by their passions. Some will look to your companions, to see whether you are the kind of husband who will treat her as an equal, while others will follow the lead of their fathers.

At any rate, it is a challenging business -- and do not forget, you may find that your suit prospers with a lady, only to have it falter on a father's political ambitions. So you must ask yourself: are you willing to risk disappointment and heartbreak? Alternately, are you willing to throw away your standing in society, to make enemies of allies, in pursuit of a forbidden love? Because if you are, then perhaps someday we will write poems about you.
What is it that you poets and musicians do again?

I compose and write songs for the lords of the land, and their ladies. Sometimes I sing about war, sometimes about the virtues of kings, and sometimes, for the more sophisticated audiences, about the virtues of wine. For most audiences, however, I sing of love.
No, that is all.
Do you have any other questions?
Gibt es noch etwas?
{reg59?My lady:My lord}, you look like a {reg59?lady:man} of the sword and someone who could help us. Will you hear my plea?
What is the matter, my good man?
What are you babbling about, peasant? Speak up.

A band of brigands has taken refuge in our village. They take everything we have, force us to serve them, and do us much evil. If one of us so much as breathes a word of protest, they kill the poor soul on the spot right away. Our lives have become unbearable. I risked my skin and ran away to find someone who can help us.
Why don't you go to the lord of your village? He should take care of the vermin.

I did, {reg59?my lady:my lord}, but our lord's men did not let me see him and said he was occupied with more important matters and that we should deal with our own problem ourselves. Please {reg59?my lady:my lord}, you look like a {reg59?lady:man} of valor and a fearsome warrior, and you have no doubt many friends and soldiers at your service. If there is anyone who can help us, it's you.
Very well, I'll help you. Where is this village?
I can't be bothered with this right now.
Why would I fight these bandits? What's in it for me?
God bless you, {reg59?lady:lord}. Our village is {s7}. It is not too far from here.
As you say, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. Forgive me for bothering you.

We are but poor farmers, {reg59?my lady:my lord}, and the bandits have already taken most of what we had in this world, but we'll be glad to share with you whatever we have left, and we'll always be in gratitude to you if you help us.
Thank you for helping us, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. Crush those bandits!
You seem somebody strong and accustomed to hard life. I am interested in recruiting you.
Sorry, I did not mean to bother you. Farewell.
Don't you see I am busy? I do not have time or inclination to join you.^^(You need 150 renown to recruit high-level troops).
We are traveling through these lands, but we might consider staying if you hire us, {reg59?madam:sir}. {reg3?Me and {reg4?{reg3} of my mates:one of my mates}:I} will join you for {reg5} peningas.
Any orders, {reg59?madam:sir}?
Make your preparations. We'll be moving at dawn.
Take your time. We'll be staying in this town for a while.
Yes {reg59?madam:sir}. We'll be ready when you tell us to leave.
All right, I will hire you. Here are {reg5} peningas.
All right, but I can only hire {reg6} of you. Here are {reg5} peningas.
That sounds good, but I can't afford to hire any more men right now.
That's a pity. Well, {reg3?we will:I will} be lingering around here for a while, if you need to hire anyone.
That sounds good, but I can't lead any more men right now.
Sorry. I don't need any other men right now.
Be careful! I won't move until it's all over.
I will kill all the bandits, and you will be free.
Thank you, good {reg59?lady:sire}. I will never forget this!
Good day to you, {reg59?lass:lad}. The captain hired me to protect his ship. Here, on matters of defense, my word is the law.
I see. You must be the veteran. Can I learn about fighting from you?
Nice to meet you. I will be back later.

Indeed, you can. I don't have anything better to do while we aren't in combat! I can find you some opponents to practice with if you like. Or if you have any questions about theory of combat, feel free to ask.
As a matter of fact, I do have a few questions.
Actually, I can move on to practice.
Well, ask anything you like.
Good. It's good to find someone eager for practice. Let's see what you will do.
That was a good fight.

Ha! Looks like you've developed a bit of a limp there. Don't worry. Even losses have their value, provided you learn from them. Shake the stars out of your eyes and get back in there. There's no other way to win.
Good day. Ready for some training today?
Well, are you ready for some training?
I am ready for some practice.
First, tell me something about combat...
I need to leave now. Farewell.
Was wollt Ihr wissen?
What else do you want to know?
Tell me about combat.
I guess I know all theory I need. Let's talk about something else.

Good question. The first thing you should know as a fighter is how to defend yourself. Keeping yourself out of harm's way is the first rule of combat, and it is much more important than giving harm to others. Everybody can swing a sword around and hope to cut some flesh, but only those fighters that are experts at defense live to tell of it.

Now. Defending yourself is easiest if you are equipped with a shield. Just block with your shield. [Hold down the right mouse button to defend yourself with the shield.] In this state, you will be able to deflect all attacks that come from your front. However, you will still be open to strikes from your sides or your back.
What if I don't have a shield?

Then you will have to use your weapon to block your opponent. This is a bit more difficult than defending with a shield. Defending with a weapon, you can block against only ONE attack direction. That is, you block against either overhead swings, side swings or thrusts. Therefore, you must watch your opponent carefully and start to block AFTER he starts his attack. In this way, you will be able to block against the direction of his current attack. If you start to block BEFORE he makes his move, he may just attack in another direction than the one you are blocking against and score a hit.

Finally, Attacking is the best defence, they say. A tactic many fighters find useful is taking an offensive stance and readying your weapon for attack, waiting for the right moment for swinging it. [You can ready your weapon for attack by pressing and holding down the left mouse button.]
That sounds useful.

It is a good tactic, but remember that, your opponent may see that and take a defensive stance against the direction you are swinging your weapon. If that happens, you must break your attack and quickly attack from another direction [You may cancel your current attack by quickly tapping the right mouse button].
If my opponent is defending against the direction I am attacking from, I will break and use another direction.

Yes, selecting the direction you swing your weapon is a crucial skill. There are four main directions you may use: right swing, left swing, overhead swing and thrust. You must use each one wisely. [To control your swing direction with default controls, move your mouse in the direction you want to swing from as you press the left mouse button].
If I may say so, I see great warrior in you. ^^Some sailors have been idle since we stopped. Let's see if one of them could help us.
A sailor will fight you. Are you ready?
Yes I am.
Here you go then. Good luck.
Just a moment. I am not ready yet.
Hey, you will never make it if you don't practice.
Please, kind {reg59?madame:sir}, help us! I don't want to be a slave!
Hi {playername}. Glad to see you are alive. I thought you were killed when Sven Bull Neck's men attacked us. I was not so lucky, as you can see.
Bodo! What? Where is my mother? And who are these women?
Let me get you out of here, my friend, and then we'll talk.
We can't talk here; there are too many ears listening. Get me out of here, and I will tell you everything.
Please, kind {reg59?madame:sir}, help us. I don't want to be a slave.
Good day, {playername}. It is good to see that you are well. You were giving us a fright, talking in your sleep. I'd hate to be the one troubled by such dreams...
I'm fine, thank you. No one has need to worry.
Well, I can't see how my affairs are anyone else's business!
Perhaps not. At any rate, it's good to see you up and about, friend.
No need to get angry! I was just speaking as a friend. It's just good to see you up and about.
Remind me who you are. To tell the truth, my mind is still a little foggy.
Thanks! Now I'm going to help check out those ships. Farewell for now.
Why, I am Bodo. I hail from Cantabria, in the Kingdom of Asturias, in the north of the land that the Romans called Hispania. We've become well acquainted on this voyage.
Then I know you've told me your story, but I'd like to hear it again.
Oh, that's right... Bodo. Well, I go now to help check out those ships. Farewell for now.
Perhaps some other time. I think right now I want to keep an eye on the horizon. I'm not as convinced as the captain that stopping here is a good idea.
I thought I saw something a minute ago, but the mist over these waters plays tricks on the eyes... Probably nothing. I hope it's nothing. This ship's fast enough, but can't outrun a warship.
I'm worried as well. I'm glad you are watching, my friend.
What could be the harm of it? But to speed things along, I will help check out those ships.
And I'm glad to do it for you. We've become such good friends on this trip, I'm sorry we will soon part. If we meet again in the future and you need my help, you have it, my friend.
{s2}^^My {reg59?daughter:son}, it is such a nice day! The sea is so bright! It is truly a pity to have all these shipwrecks spoil the scene!
Yes, Mother. I'm glad you are well today.
You remember me? That's wonderful!
I will see you later, Mother.
{s2}^^Not only well but happy! I'm glad we made this trip, but we must remember to be home to make dinner! Your father will expect it.
{s2}^^You are my baby. I am your mother. Why would I or Father forget you?
Aber... Vater ist tot.
Mother, we are going home right now. I love you.
{s2}^^But... But... We aren't on a trip near home, are we? My head hurts so much, I don't remember where home is! I know who you are, but I don't remember your name. Am I crazy?
No, you've only forgotten a few things.
No, you're just sick. But soon we will see someone that will make you better.
Yes, but we're getting help for you. Farewell, then, for the moment.
{s2}^^Oh dear. I think I need a moment alone. Please go.
{s2}^^I am not so sure that anybody can heal this, my {reg59?daughter:son}.
We are almost there! Please don't give up now. We'll talk more later.
I'd like to chat, but I must complete my chores now.
Ic grete thee, {playername}. I'd like to chat, but I must complete my chores now. We will talk later.
Very well. We will talk tonight at the anchorage.
[Enemy lookouts watch you closely from the walls of Readingum.]
Talk to the boss, {playername}, that veteran in the prow of the boat over there. He's the one that can best train you in fighting.
Thanks, I will do that.
West thu hal, {playername}. Are you well today? You were moving violently in your sleep and saying incomprehensible things. My sailors thought you were being tormented by a spirit.
Where am I? What is this place?
Oh, this is bad. You don't remember anything? My name is Avo, leof. I am the captain of this ship, the Woden Ric. You embarked with us in Friese some weeks ago, paying well for us to take you on.
Yes, yes, I remember now.
Oh, it's coming back to me now, but perhaps you can remind me why am I here?
Well, don't worry. These things happen to everyone.

Now I'm really starting to worry about you. I don't know the details, but do know that you worry for your mother. She is sick, and you were taking her to a priest of great healing ability in the Frisian port where we are going.
Thanks! But it's light out. Shouldn't we be under full sail? The boat is not moving! What is happening? Why have we stopped?
May we talk later, {reg59?madame:sir}? I need to give some orders to my men.
Good day. We are ready to cast off. Are you ready?
I am ready. Please, let us continue our voyage.
No, I need to do something before we leave.
{s2}^^We've been together on this voyage some time. Would you like to try the rudder? She steers very nimbly for a merchantman.
Why, I've been wondering when you'd ask!
No. Believe me, I think you'd want me to touch it only a last resort!

We found a bit of wreckage, some half-sunken ships. Looks like there was a fight here recently. I have my men checking out the situation and looking for survivors. Poor bastards wouldn't have had a chance against Viking long ships. We'll be on our way soon enough, though.
Oh. Could we hurry it along? Whoever sunk those ships might still be nearby.
Well, finally a bit of excitement! I think I'll go and help them.
{s2}^^Relax, {reg59?woman:man}. Your friend, Bodo, insisted on keeping watch. I doubt that fellow ever misses a thing!
Bodo? Yes. Well, I'm still worried.
I sure hope you know what you're doing.
{s2}^^If you had been on one of those ships instead of this one, you'd want us to stop, now wouldn't you? It's the law of the sea -- especially this sea.
Be assured, I do, {reg59?madame:sir}. Now let me tend to this matter, or we'll be delayed even longer.
Oh, Woden, we're in trouble!
May we talk later, {reg59?madame:sir}? I need to give some orders to my men.
What's happened?

Shh! Keep quiet. Listen, we're in danger. As we were watching your fight, two long ships arrived. Now I can see the banner. It's Sven Bull-Neck. Ah, dammit! You'd better pray to whatever gods you worship. Hell, you may as well pray to those you don't! Won't matter at all if he catches us.
I knew this would happen! We should not have stopped.
Calm down, man! Tell me: who's Sven?
This is terrible news! What shall we do?

You've not heard of him? Sven's a Viking. Worse, a Viking's Viking. He burns villages and sinks ships and enslaves or kills everyone in them. Everyone! But it's worst for the one he chooses for a hideous death as a sacrifice to his gods. Heard of Blodorn, the Blood Eagle? You don't want to know what that means. Now keep quiet.
{s2}^^I think they're passing by. If we stay still right here, they may just think we're another bit of the wreckage. That's our only hope.
What? We should have already been escaping into the mist. Row, men, for all it's worth!
Please, calm down, my friend. We mustn't make a wrong move here!
{s1}^^Sven's spotted us! They're turning this way! Nothing for it but to move. Cut the anchor and start rowing! Oh, Woden, it's no use. Help!

Greetings! My name is Petro Didaz of Oveto, and I am a duke in the service of King Aldefonso of Asturias. These men are Silo, who comes from Farum in Gallaecia, and Gundinsalvo, who comes from Amaia, in Cantabria. We are surprised that you have submitted to us with so many ships and men. We want to know who you are.
My name is {playername}. I come on behalf of the sons of Ragnar to negotiate with you.
My name is {playername}. Aethelred, the king of West Seaxe, sends me to serve as your escort to his kingdom.
I do not think that's...
Ragnar's sons are powerful and well-known men. You should hear their proposal.
{s2}^^Yes, listen to their messenger. After he sings his song, we can kill him.
Rathbarth Ragnarsson wants you to join him and his brothers against West Seaxe.
Rathbarth Ragnarsson promises you half of West Seaxe if you join him.
Rathbarth Ragnarsson will fill your boat with riches if you join him.
And if they do not join, what will he do? Kill them? Did he send you here with a fleet to make friends?
Bodo?
Exactly. It is your choice.
If I wanted you dead, I would have attacked. I am offering an alliance with fellow winners.
{s2}^^I like things simple and clear. I like this guy.
Now you're talking.

This {reg59?woman:man} is a liar. I traveled with {reg59?her:him} for a long time. I offered {reg59?her:him} my friendship. I fought beside {reg59?her:him} and served {reg59?her:him} faithfully. But when the time came, {reg59?she:he} betrayed me and delivered the letter to the Vikings. That's why {reg59?she:he} is here today with that fleet: to destroy you and the alliance between West Seaxe, Frankia and Asturias.
The Danish rule the North. It will take an alliance to keep Asturias safe.
West Seaxe is weak and ripe for conquest. Don't you want to enjoy the glory and loot?
I didn't come this far to listen to this nonsense. What is your decision?

That has been my position for some time now. Better Danmark than West Seaxe. The Danish control practically all the north while West Seaxe barely controls its own kingdom. An alliance with the Danish would mean that the Vikings would stay away from Asturias. Maybe we could even use them against Al-Andalus.
What? Then all the fun would end. I like killing Vikings and keeping their boats.

Someone who truly knows the north would not say that. The king of the Danish does not have the power to control the Vikings. The Vikings are free men who have embraced the sea to get wealth and fame, and if their king tried to stop them, they would find another king.
West Seaxe can still fight, and I think it would be quite good at it. You sing well, messenger. It would be nice to switch our looting to places other than the lands of the Moors.
Well, this sounds good to me.
You're forgetting that our king has an alliance with the king of West Seaxe. Is it your intention to disobey your king?
Do not be deceived by {reg59?her:his} flattering words. Anyone who pays attention to {reg59?her:him} ends badly.
Are you listening to {reg59?her:him}? Makes demands like a king, and if they are not accepted, threatens with the sword.
Bodo ist ein guter Mann. Aber er wird dich in die Vernichtung führen, wenn du auf ihn hören solltest.
Es ist an der Zeit für dich eine Entscheidung zu treffen.
Es gab eine Zeit, da habe ich dich geliebt und bewundert. Aber du hast mich hereingelegt und ich werde dir niemals vergeben. Es wird der Tag kommen, an dem du durch meine Hand sterben wirst.
I have already expressed my opinion. My men will join the sons of Ragnar and make an alliance with the Danish in favor of Asturias. King Aldefonso will be satisfied.
I did not bleed for a kingdom destined to perish. I'm with Silo. Join the Danish and ransack West Seaxe.
Ich würde es vorziehen, Dänen anstatt Sachsen zu töten... Ja, das ist meine Entscheidung.
King Aldefonso named me, his duke, lord of this army, to complete our mission of helping West Seaxe. Barring orders to the contrary, that is our goal, and anything else is treason.

Your people cannot be trusted, Duke Petro. I am Bodo Vimaraniz from Malacoria. You know me, I am a man of the royal court, and here is my seal. I did not want to resort to this...^^I am the word of the king here. I have given an order to have the West Seaxe fleet attack {playername}'s fleet. Look over there and enjoy the show!

Silo is a traitor and will be executed. Gundinsalvo will gather and embark his Cantabrians now and prepare for battle. You, Petro, will leave some men here to protect our food supply and send the rest with Gundinsalvo. {playername} shall return to {reg59?her:his} ship to die with {reg59?her:his} men. We will advance from here with our ships in a pincer attack and end this matter. Then we will travel in aid of West Seaxe as agreed.
You are not the king, and you have ordered an attack without our consent. This breaks all the rules. I'm going with {playername}, but I will not fight.
Bodo, du hast vollkommen den Verstand verloren! Du schickst diese Männer in den sicheren Tod.
Bis bald.
Away with {playername}! Everyone must prepare for battle. Gundinsalvo, go with your men, but if you happen to betray us, you will pay dearly!
{Playername} willkommen, wir haben dich schon vor Tagen erwartet.
Der König von West Seaxe schickte ein Niemand. Das ist eine Beleidigung!
{s2}^^You get offended too easily, Silo.
Dieser Mann neben mir, Bodo, ist aus Asturien.
Wie viele Männer und Schiffe hast du?
{s2}^^Hah! I like someone who gets straight to the point.
Thank you, {playername}, but Petro knows who I am. He has seen me in the royal court. I am one of the king's men, as my seal shows.

They have more than 500 men and more than 20 boats, many of them obtained from the defeated Danish, {playername}. Petro knows me. He has seen me in the royal court. I am one of the king's men, as my seal shows.
Yes, I'm glad to see you, Bodo. It has been many years.
True, but now you know where I have been. This alliance between West Seaxe, Asturias and Frankia is my work.
Glad to see this meeting of old friends.
Well, before we leave, we have to talk about that man, Silo.
Very diplomatic, but we have to tackle a thorny issue. Silo has been providing information to the Danish.
What! What are you talking about?

Sigurd Ragnarsson mentioned his name when he spoke to {playername} about a traitor in Asturias who's been sending them information regularly. So Sigurd knew about the letter and my movements. He also knows about this fleet now.
Everything he says is true.
Silo should die now.
(Sagen Sie nichts)
What? You judge and condemn me merely based on the word of this stranger, mere riffraff? By God! I have a noble rank!
Kill him? This is a bit hasty, don't you think?
You should fear what I have to say more than anything else.

Bodo's word means considerably more to me than any other proof or witness. However, we are not in the position to judge or condemn, for that is the king's prerogative. Silo, if you are a traitor, pray God to protect you, for the king won't have mercy. For now, you will be imprisoned and sent back to Asturias with the witness, {playername}, while we will continue on to West Seaxe.
Very well, I will go to Asturias to testify against this man, Silo.
Sorry, I can't go to Asturias. I have an unfinished business back in Englaland.

I think no one is going anywhere. If I'm not mistaken, that smoke you see on the horizon comes from our guest's ships. It seems that the Danish have arrived. Maybe now you would understand my strategy.
By the gods! Sorry, I mean my God! Both fleets are maneuvering for battle. The smoke comes from fire arrows.
You must have the eyes of an eagle, Cantabro. We must help our allies before the Danes destroy them. Silo, we need your men on our side, they are the best sailors in our fleet.
You should've thought of that before making grave accusations. My men will fight with me... Well, the Danish brought more boats, and I always ally with the winner.

You traitorous scum! I am taking the overall command. {playername}, return to your ships and try to contain the Danish. Gundinsalvo will be in charge of our fleet and will join you. I'll stay here in a safe place to coordinate a defense on the ground, so that you have a place to withdraw to if things go bad.^^Go!
You're insane! You should surrender. To me, my men! For Gallaecia!

Good day to you {reg59?lass:lad}. You look like another adventurer who has come to try {reg59?her:his} chance in these lands. Well, trust my word. You won't be able to survive long here unless you know how to fight yourself out of a tight spot.
Thank you for your advice. This place looks like a training field. Can I learn about fighting here?

Indeed, you can. I am a veteran soldier... fought a good deal in the wars in my time. But these days, I train young novices in this area. I can find you some opponents to practice with if you like. Or if you have any questions about theory of combat, feel free to ask.
Yes, I do have a few questions.
Actually, I can move on to practice.
Well, ask anything you like.
Good. It's good to find someone eager for practice. Let's see what you will do.
That was a good fight.

Ha! Looks like you've developed a bit of a limp there. Don't worry. Even losses have their value, provided you learn from them. Shake the stars out of your eyes and get back in there. There's no other way to win.
Good day. Ready for some training today?
Ah, are you ready for some training?
Anything else, {playername}?
I am ready for some practice.
First, tell me something about combat...
Good day, {playername}. How may I help you?
I'd like to discuss training options.
I can take your recruits and turn them into warriors.
I need some men to be trained.
Please, stop training my men here.
Macht nichts.
Wollen Sie, dass ich eine alternative Förderung in Betracht ziehe, wenn diese verfügbar wird?
Ja.
Nein.
Nun gut, ich werder die Rekruten in {s11} trainieren. Platziere die Männer die dich lehren soll am Ende der Liste in der Garnison.
As you wish, my {reg59?lady:lord}.
I need to leave now. Farewell.
Was wollt Ihr wissen?
What else do you want to know?
Tell me about defending myself.
Tell me about attacking with weapons.
Tell me about fighting on horseback.
I guess I know all theory I need. Let's talk about something else.

Good question. The first thing you should know as a fighter is how to defend yourself. Keeping yourself out of harm's way is the first rule of combat, and it is much more important than giving harm to others. Everybody can swing a sword around and hope to cut some flesh, but only those fighters that are experts at defense live to tell of it.

Now. Defending yourself is easiest if you are equipped with a shield. Just block with your shield. [Hold down the right mouse button to defend yourself with the shield.] In this state, you will be able to deflect all attacks that come from your front. However, you will still be open to strikes from your sides or your back.
What if I don't have a shield?

Then you will have to use your weapon to block your opponent. This is a bit more difficult than defending with a shield. Defending with a weapon, you can block against only ONE attack direction. That is, you block against either overhead swings, side swings or thrusts. Therefore, you must watch your opponent carefully and start to block AFTER he starts his attack. In this way, you will be able to block against the direction of his current attack. If you start to block BEFORE he makes his move, he may just attack in another direction than the one you are blocking against and score a hit.

Good question. Attacking is the best defence, they say. A tactic many fighters find useful is taking an offensive stance and readying your weapon for attack, waiting for the right moment for swinging it. [You can ready your weapon for attack by pressing and holding down the left mouse button.]
That sounds useful.

It is a good tactic, but remember that, your opponent may see that and take a defensive stance against the direction you are swinging your weapon. If that happens, you must break your attack and quickly attack from another direction [You may cancel your current attack by quickly tapping the right mouse button].
If my opponent is defending against the direction I am attacking from, I will break and use another direction.

Yes, selecting the direction you swing your weapon is a crucial skill. There are four main directions you may use: right swing, left swing, overhead swing and thrust. You must use each one wisely. [To control your swing direction with default controls, move your mouse in the direction you want to swing from as you press the left mouse button].

Very good question. A horse may be a warrior's most powerful weapon in combat. It gives you speed, height, power and initiative. A lot of deadly weapons will become even deadlier on horseback. However, you must pay particular attention to horse-mounted enemies couching their lances, as they may take down any opponent in one hit. [To use the couched lance yourself, wield a lance or similar weapon, and speed up your horse without pressing attack or defense buttons. after you reach a speed, you'll lower your lance. Then try to target your enemies by maneuvering your horse.]
I train novices in four stages, each tougher than the one before. To finish a stage and advance to the next one, you have to win three fights in a row.
You have passed all stages of training, but if you want, you can still practice. Are you ready?

Way to go {reg59?lass:lad}. With this victory, you have advanced to the next training level. From now on, your opponents will be regular fighters, not the riff-raff off the street, so be on your toes.

Way to go {reg59?lass:lad}. Welcome to the third training level. From now on, your opponents will be veteran fighters -- soldiers and arena regulars and the like. These guys know some dirty tricks, so keep your defense up.

You've got the heart of a champion, {reg59?lass:lad}, and the sword arm to match. From now on, your opponents will be champion fighters. These are the cream of the crop, the finest warriors I have trained. If you can best three of them in a row, you will join their ranks.
It does my heart good to see such a promising talent. You have passed all tiers of training. You can now tell everyone that you have been trained by the master of the training field.
Thank you master.
I wish you good luck in the tournaments. And, don't forget, if you want to practice your sword work anytime, just come and say the word.
Your next opponent will be a {s9}. You need to win {reg8} more fights in a row to advance to the next stage. Are you ready?
Yes I am.
Here you go then. Good luck.
Just a moment. I am not ready yet.
Hey, you will never make it if you don't practice.
Good day, my {reg59?lady:lord}. We hope to begin production in about {reg4} days
Good day, my {reg59?lady:lord}. We are honored that you have chosen to visit us. What do you require?
Very good, my {reg59?lady:lord}. Do you require anything else?
Let's go over the accounts.
Let's check the inventories.
I'd like you to sell goods as they are produced.
I'd like you to keep all goods in the warehouse until I arrive.

We currently produce {s3} worth {reg1} peningas each week, while the quantity of {s4} needed to manufacture it costs {reg2}, and labor and upkeep are {reg3}.{s9} This means that we theoretically make a {s12} of {reg0} peningas a week, assuming that we have no raw materials in the inventories, and that we sell directly to the market.
Could you explain my options related to production?

Certainly, my {reg59?lady:lord}. Most of the time, the most profitable thing for you to do would be to let us buy raw materials and sell the finished goods directly to the market. Because of our longstanding relations with the local merchants, we can usually get a very good price.

However, if you find that you can acquire raw materials cheaper outside {s5}, you may place them in the inventories, and we will use them instead of buying from the market. Likewise, if you feel that you can get a better price for the finished goods elsewhere, then you may ask us to deposit what we produce in our warehouses for you to take.
It will no longer be possible for me to continue operating this enterprise.
A pity, my {reg59?lady:lord}. If we sell the land and the equipment, and liquidate the inventories, I estimate that we can get {reg4} peningas.
That sounds reasonable. Please proceed with the sale.
Hmm. Let's hold off on that.
As you wish. It was an honor to have been in your employ.
That is all for now.
Ave, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. I am the kingdom's bard. I can recite you a poem or I can craft songs and poems about your honor and valour.
My art and skill will not disappoint you, my lord. What else do you need?
I want you to sing about me. I need to be known and famous.
I want you to write a poem for a lady.
It will cost you 500 peningas. What is the name of the lady?
Macht nichts.
Very well, I will write a poem, and will recite it to {s34}, it will take me one week to do it.

My lord, I will write a poem so epic that the whole Northlands will know about the greatness of {playername} - he jumps with joy. -Finally, he stops and takes a deep breath-. In return, I am asking for a small sum to cover the cost of inks and... keep my creativity going. I will need 500 coins.
Take the money. It is nothing to a mighty hero like me.
You ask for the same price as a happy widow, and undoubtedly I'd like her performance better.
Kannst du für mich und meine Männer singen ?
A bard? Songs? Why don't you go out and earn your bread like the rest of us?
It will cost you 100 coins, I can sing...
Your best song.
Never mind. I want to ask you something else.
I would like to know about the 'Treasures of Britannia.'

Well, if you really want to know... then hear me! There are thirteen Treasures of Brittania:^One: Dyrnwyn, White Hilt, the sword of Rhydderch Hael. If a well-born man draw it, it bursts into flame from its hilt to its tip. Moreover, anyone who asks for it receives it. Because of this peculiarity, anyone Rhydderch would offer it to would reject it. Therefore, he was called Rhydderch the Generous.^^Two: The Hamper of Gwyddno Garanhir. Food for one man would be put in it, but when it was opened again, food for a hundred men would be found in it.

Three: The Horn of Bran Galed from the north. Whatever drink might be wished for would be found in it.^Four: The Chariot of Morgan Mwynfawr. Wherever the driver might wish to be, there it would travel, and quickly.^Five: The Halter of Clydno Eiddyn. This was fixed by a staple to the foot of his bed. Whatever horse he might wish for, he would find in the halter.^Six: The Knife of Llawfrodedd Farchog. This would allow twenty and four men to eat at table.^Seven: The Cauldron of Dyrnwch the Giant. If meat for a brave man were put in it, it would instantly be cooked.

Eight: The Whetstone of Tudwal Tudglyd. Any sword sharpened on this whetstone would not fail to kill any man from whom it drew blood.^Nine: The Coat of Padarn Beisrudd. If a well-born man put it on, it would be the right size for him.^Ten and Eleven: The Crock and the Dish of Rhygenydd the Cleric. Whatever food might be wished for, it would be found in them.^Twelve: The Chessboard of Gwenddoleu ap Ceidio. If the pieces were set, they would play by themselves. The board was of gold, and the men of silver.^Thirteen: The Mantle of Arthur of Cornwall. Whoever is under it cannot be seen, yet he himself can see everyone.
I would like to find these treasures.
Interesting song. Thank you.
Sorry, friend. That is a difficult quest. Most of the treasures were destroyed in Myrdyn's times, and the rest was lost. I doubt they'll ever be found.
Sorry to hear that.
I think you're lying to me. I want the treasure now, or you will die.
I'm tired of this, Farewell.

An ancestor of mine, Owain map Modred, told me about another man deceived by my ancestor's enemy, Conchobor, centuries ago. He tried to find the treasures in the days of kings Penda and Cadwallon, but was unsuccessful. The treasures are lost, and it's better this way.

Do you think if I had these treasures, I would be here serving a king? No, I would be reviving the old knowledge of the Druids and trying to regain the Britannia that was lost with the death of my father. Farewell.
I have no need for a bard at this time.
In nomine Patris, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. I am a priest. I see in your eyes that you are a pious soul.
God guard you, {playername}. What can this humble servant do for you?
I am not a Christian, you crow! I spit on you, for Christians are like weak sheep... I worship the ancient gods, and I love war, blood and chaos!

You... You... You are Satan, {playername} - his eyes burn like fire lit by the very flames of Hell - begone from my sight. This land shall neither feed you nor give you rest, for your place is among heathen lands soon to be burnt by God's wrath.
I am a Christian, my father -you bow your head in respect-, and I must atone for my past sins.
I am not a Christian, but I wish to be converted (conversion to Christianity).
I have no need for a man of God at this time.

Come, my child! - He smiles, pleased. - Our God is one of forgiveness and acceptance, not of revenge and hate like the Pagan devils the barbarians are so keen to worship. I am here to help you, {playername}, but you must also help the Church in return. I will pray for your soul, so that you may spend your eternal afterlife in Heaven, but you must donate 300 peningas. - He places his hand confidentially on your shoulder. - I can also preach in your name, {playername}, and let all the land know of your Christian purity and holiness, but you must fund my travels through the land. This will cost you 1000 peningas.
Praise God, that he may cleanse us of our sins. I will donate 300 coins.
Ego absolvo te a peccatis tuis, in nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus Sanctii. Amen.
Thank you father, I want this land to love me. I will give you 1000 coins.
Are you selling your Faith? You are a pig! May my god feast upon your guts!
Actually, cancel that order.

West thu hal, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. I am a priest of Odin, the almighty carrier-off the dead, which, if brave enough, forever rest by his side at the great halls of Walhalla. He is also the trickster god, the one-eyed one, and the leader of the Wild Hunt.
West thu hal, {playername}. What do you need?
I am not a pagan, but follow Christ! You should do the same.

Oooooodiiiiin! Only because we are in this place will I not immediately offer your life to the gods. - The priest's eyes burn with hot fire. - Begone from my sight! Let this land neither feed you nor give you rest, but speed you away to a cursed grave.
I am still true to the pagan ways, praying to Woden and waging war. - You bow your head. -
I wish to be taught about the old gods so that I might honor them (conversion to paganism).
I have no need for a man of any god at this time.

Come, brave warrior! - He smiles, pleased. - Odin is more than pleased to smile upon great warriors like yourself, and he knows your feats of arms. I am here to bring you back to honour the old gods of our ancestors, {playername}, but you must also help us. Christianity spreads like a plague and displaces the old gods from their rightful seats. We need money to recruit warriors to kill their cowardly clerics. - He places his hands on your shoulders. - We ask for just 300 peningas. I can even tell everyone how {playername} is truly favoured by Odin, Thor, and Freiya, letting all the kingdom know of your respect for our gods, but you must fund my travels. My travel expenses would amount to 1000 peningas for that.
Kill them all. I will donate 300 coins.

Thank you, warrior of Woden. I will talk to your men about Woden and his sons Wecta, Baeldaeg, Casere and Wihtlaeg. That will encourage them to fight proudly by your side, to earn their seats at Waelcyrge.
Thank you. I want this realm to love and respect me. I will give you 1000 coins.
Are you selling to Woden? What a pig you are!
Actually, cancel that order.
Well, have you talked to them?^For us, these lands are very important, and the jarl's happiness, you must know, depends on ours.^^Are you ready for a verdict?
Are you ready for my judgment?
What may I do for you?
Ja?
I am here for your petition to {s4}. Please explain what has happened.
{s2}^^I expected... some other person. The jarl, or one of his close associates. May I ask who you are, {reg59?madame:sir}?
My name is {playername}. {s4} is busy, so I am your {reg59?judge:man}.
I am {playername}, a devout fellow Christian. I am here for your help, Father.
{playername}. Remember my name, priest, or my gods will burn your shabby robe. Now, what is it?
{s2}^^Some weeks ago, a monk found this document in our archives. It is a letter where a previous lord three generations back donated land next to the monastery to us. You can read it.
Let me read it.
(You don't know how to read, but feign to the abbot that you are reading the document.)
I don't know how to read. Just tell me what it is about.

{s2}Well, the document is right and proper, with witnesses and donor name. The problem is that currently a family resides on this piece of land. They say the land has been theirs for generations, but the monastery owns these plots, and we want them to leave.
Well, call the head of family and the monk who found the document. I want to question them.
I don't have the time now. I will be back later.
Yes. My verdict is that the land belongs to the monastery.
Yes. My verdict is that the land belongs to the farmer.
Yes. My verdict is that the land belongs to the jarl.
Yes. My verdict is that the land belongs to nobody.
No, I need more time to talk with them.

I am sure you have made the right decision. Go back to the jarl and advise him that we are very happy with the outcome. We will tell the people that he is just and devout. Oh, and we have a little gift for you.
What? That land is ours! Well, if the jarl wants problems, he shall have them. Leave. Now.
I have come to get a book called: 'The Cathach of Colum Cille.'
About the book, 'The Cathach of Colum Cille'...
I have come to return 'The Cathach of Colum Cille' to you.

But... but... that's not possible {reg59?lady:lord}. 'The Cathach of Colum Cille' is a relic, it is a copy made at night by a miraculous light of Colum Cille - Saint Columba! Moreover, the book doesn't even belong to us. We are just the guardians. It really belongs to Clan o Domhnaill from Ui Neill. It serves as a rallying cry and protector in battle. It protects them in battle and guarantees victory in war. Do you want to become an enemy of the Ui Neill?
I say, I will take the book, regardless, and I will kill anyone who stands in my way.
Pater, I am a Christian, and this book is very important to me. I will make a donation.
I need this book to rescue prisoners. Isn't that the work of God? To save lives? (Persuasion)
If you do not give me the book, I will kill everyone here. (Power Strike)
Then you have to kill us all and take the book from our dead hands. God will make us martyrs and condemn you.
Verzeiht, aber dies ist ein Relikt, und es ist zu heilig, als dass man es mit Geld bezahlen könnte.
Pater, it is too important for me. I need to find the hideout where a Viking holds prisoners. They are in danger. You must help me, pater. This book is my only hope to save them.

I understand that you want to save innocent people, but the book belongs to the Ui Neill of Aileach and Mide. Well, I could give it to you, for your cause is honorable. I could tell the Ui Neill that you are a Viking who stole it from us by the sword, but they will hate you and become your enemies. Are you sure?
I'm not moved by your words.
Thank you. May God bless you.

I understand that you want to save innocent people, but the book belongs to the Ui Neill of Aileach and Mide. Well, I could give it to you. Your cause is honorable, and I could tell the Ui Neill that a Viking stole it from us by the sword, and not mention your name.
I'm not moved by your words. Sorry.
Thank you, pater. God will be pleased.
Yes, pater. I do not mind the enmity of Ui Neill. I only desire to save people dearest to me.
You are right. Let me think about this.
Well, here's the book. Take care of it. It is a valuable relic. If one day you are able, bring it back.
Then you have to kill us all and take the book from our dead hands. God will make us martyrs and condemn you.
Take the book. I will not allow you to kill all those people, but a divine curse will fall on you. Now, go away, demon.
I received your message. Why have you sent for me?
I could be interested in your offer.
'Die Schlange' ist tot.
Morrigan wird kein Problem mehr sein.
We have to talk about Mael Bresail.
I know where Flaithbertach's grandchildren are.

That's good news. You're lucky, for my patron wants to hear it directly from you. He is a powerful man who doesn't like long florid stories. When he asks you something, just give him a simple answer. I assure you that if you make a good impression, you will have a bright future. My patron's name is Mael Bresail. You can find him at the court of Aileach.
Very well, I will see you soon.
I talked to Mael Bresail.
Yes, I know. You surely noticed that he is generous toward those who serve him well.
Yes, the man is rich and takes care of his own.
He didn't impress me at all.
I believe you owe me a reward.
I'm glad to hear that, but back to our business. Here is your reward for finding out where Flaithbertach's grandchildren were hiding.
I guess you didn't have enough time to get to know him better, but back to our business. Here is your reward for finding out where Flaithbertach's grandchildren were hiding.
Well, well, back quickly to what's important to you. Here is your reward for finding out where Flaithbertach's grandchildren were hiding.
Thank you, but he mentioned another task...
He told me that I would get more peningas. (persuasion)
Did he say that? Then let me open my purse again. I'll give you 2,000 peningas more. Now, it's time to talk about out next task.
I like jokes, but we have more important things to deal with. Please, let's be serious. Time to talk about out next task.
Very well, I am listening.
Thank you for the money. Who is your patron?
Thank you for the money. I am listening.
Give this money to the orphans. Who is your patron?
Pater, give this money to the orphans and widows.
You will learn that in time. For now, I will only say that he is someone important, a man who can make or break kings.

I appreciate your interest in our orphans, but I cannot answer your question. My patron wants to remain anonymous for now. I will tell you that he is someone important, so important that he sits at the table with kings, and they listen.

You will be surprised to know that my patron is a mighty man, and yet he has chosen you. He watches you, for his spies and informers are everywhere. He has entrusted you with an important mission, for which you will be generously rewarded.
Speaking of reward is music to my ears.
Ich höre.
Well...

--The abbot clears his throat and fixes his eyes on yours--^^A dangerous man, a robber and a murderer, the enemy of my patron, has taken refuge in the old land of the Picts and is recruiting an army of outlaws. He plans to return to Eriu and attack the good people that live here. My patron's spies have found out that this man is recruiting warriors from the mead hall of Scuin. This man must be stopped. You will be paid 5,000 peningas to put an end to his life.
Tell me about this man and why he must die.
Five thousand peningas? Sounds good, but I want another 1,000 in advance for expenses.
Without a doubt, I am your {reg59?woman:man}.
Nein, ich bin nicht interessiert. Verzeiht mir.
He is called 'the Snake.' He is an exile and descendant of a cursed family who tried to impose their power in Eriu. It took a lot of effort and lives to defeat him, but The 'Snake' escaped.
Five thousand peningas? Sounds good, but I want another 1,000 for expenses now.
Without a doubt, I am your {reg59?woman:man}.
Nein, ich bin nicht interessiert. Verzeiht mir.
Money is not a problem. Take 1,000 peningas. Now, we have a deal.
Very well, I guess you need time to think about it. Come back if you change your mind.
Very well. I recommend that you travel with all haste to Scuin. Look for a man there called The 'Snake' in the mead hall. Return quickly once the problem is solved. Godspeed.
You keep those 5,000 peningas handy, for I will return soon.
I shall certainly do so, pater.

I know. Our spy sent a messenger with the news. Here is your reward. As you see, my patron is very generous.^^That being said, I have a suggestion. Our spy told us that you had bantered away with The 'Snake' too much. This was a mistake. He could have dissuaded you, and also the less you know about my patron's business, the better it is, for your own sake.
Is that a threat?
Ich verstehe.
That's what I do.
Hardly. I am an abbot, not a killer. It was a suggestion. Do what you want.^^But enough about that. I have another task for you that pays even better.
It was just a suggestion. You are being paid well for this work, so it would be foolish to annoy your patron.^^But enough about that. I have another task for you that pays even better.
There is another danger that threatens Eriu...
I hope that it is not another murder. I am not an assassin.
[Nichts sagen.]
No, thank God. In this case, it is only information. Listen.

Across the sea, Caer Meguaidd has become a refuge for the enemies of Eriu. It is a place that breeds intrigues. Two people in particular pose dangers to us - they are Flaithbertach's grandchildren. Your mission is simple: go and find out where they are hiding. As nobody connects you with my patron, you can simply ask the mayor, a man called Donngal, for this information. For this easy task, you will get another 5,000 peningas.
We have a deal.
Nein, ich bin nicht interessiert. Verzeiht.
You're working for my boss; I'm just a messenger. I give you information; you do what you want.
Donngal has a weakness for gold. I'm sure you'll be able to convince him. Come back as soon as possible with news about the location of Flaithbertach's grandchildren. Good luck.
You keep those 5,000 peningas handy, for I will return soon.
Farewell, pater.

--The abbot clears his throat and fixes his eyes on yours--^^At the west end of Eriu there is a village with, err... problems. It is a remote place, near harsh, sea-beaten cliffs and populated by fishermen. Its residents have asked for help because a great evil has befallen them. It shatters men beyond recognition and kidnaps their wives and children.

My patron wants you to travel to this village, Bal Luighne, and talk to its leader. He will tell you all the details. Then put an end to the evil in the area and come back here. Nothing particularly complicated, but you will be paid handsomely for fulfilling your mission. To be precise, you will be paid 10,000 peningas for this favor.
Are there not lords of Eriu that can deal with this problem?
Can you tell me more about the evil that attacks them?
Ten thousand peningas? Sounds good, but I want 2,000 extra for expenses now.
If these people need help, I will go. Without a doubt, I am your hero.
Nein, ich bin nicht interessiert. Verzeiht.
The lords in Eriu are too busy making war on each other, and the area near Bal Luighne is remote and unimportant. I hope my patron didn't make a mistake in selecting you...
I have nothing else to add. The news lacks details, and the fishermen are terrified. I think the area leader of Bal Luighne would be the best person to get details from.
As you know, money is not a problem, and I apologize for underestimating your needs. Take 2,000 more peningas. Now, we have a deal.
That's what I expected to hear. My patron certainly was not wrong about you.
I understand, but this is a unique opportunity for you. If you do not accept, another warlord will take the job. Are you sure you're not interested?
Can you tell me more about the evil that attacks them?
Forget what I said. I will go. Without a doubt, I am your hero.
Yes, I am sure. I'm not interested. Farewell.
Well, I'm sorry about your answer, but I respect your decision. We will not be bothering you anymore.
Ten thousand peningas? Sounds good, but I want 2,000 extra for expenses now.
Are there not lords of Eriu that can deal with this problem?
If these people need help, I will go. Without a doubt, I am your hero.
Nein, ich bin nicht interessiert. Verzeiht.
I recommend that you take your best weapons and travel with all haste to Bal Luighne. Look for a man there called Caliacas. Return quickly once the problem is solved. Godspeed.
You keep those 10,000 peningas handy, for I will return soon.
I shall certainly do so, pater.

I did not expect anything less from you. Caliacas sent a messenger confirming that the attacks have ceased and the farmers have burned the devil's lair where Morrigan was hiding. Now, thanks to you, this world is safer. Here is your reward: 10,000 peningas.
Thank you, abbot.
Give that money to my men. They deserve all this silver.

I have bad news. The men sent to kill Flaithbertach's grandchildren had succeeded, but when the Ard Ruire, Aed mac Niall, saw the bodies, he said that they were not the right children. Angry, he ordered the men executed. The king knows you were involved, so I would stay far away from his reach.

I have bad news. When men sent to kill Flaithbertach's grandchildren came to the farm, they found nobody. I don't know what happened, but the Ard Ruire, Aed mac Niall, has promised to punish you if you cross his path. I would stay far away from his reach.

For my part, I have finished my task. Now you must go and see Mael Bresail. From now on, you will deal directly with him. Just a tip: he is a powerful, easy to anger man, and I wouldn't want him as my enemy. Never lie to him and stay loyal, and everything will be fine... Otherwise, you may not live too long. Good luck, {playername}.

For my part, I have finished my task. Now you must go and see Mael Bresail. From now on, you will deal directly with him. Just a tip: he is a powerful, easy to anger man, and I wouldn't want him as my enemy Never lie to him and stay loyal, and everything will be fine... Otherwise, you may not live too long. Good luck, {playername}.
You look tense. Did everything go well with our patron?
Your patron tried to kill me. Where can I find him now?
I will be back later.

Did he try to kill you? Sorry, I knew nothing. I warned you that you need to serve him faithfully and unequivocally. Our patron is a man who rewards good work but punishes disloyalty or neglect severely.
I do not have time to chat. Where is he? Hurry!
Your master organized a feast and tried to burn me inside the hall. (Persuasion)
Do not waste my time. Reply now, or I'll kill you and burn your monastery. (Power Strike)
I will be back later.
I cannot tell you what I do not know. You can torture me or kill me, but you will not get any further response from my lips.
This monastery needs silver to continue to prosper. Give me this information and I will donate 4,000 peningas, abbot.
Your master organized a feast and tried to burn me inside the hall. (Persuasion)
Do not waste my time. Reply now, or I'll kill you and burn your monastery. (Power Strike)
Ich bin später wieder zurück.

This monastery has been hard pressed by the attacks of the Vikings, so we need the money. I cannot refuse your donation and believe that this information will not cause harm to anyone. However, if somebody asks me, I will deny talking to you. Mael Bresail is very dangerous.

If Mael Bresail tried to kill me, it's likely he wants to eliminate all witnesses that may link him to the murder of Flaithbertach's grandchildren. Besides me, you are the only one who knows all the details. You are also at risk. If I find your boss soon, your life and mine will last longer. You know I am right.
But I am only a messenger, an intermediary between his desires and those who execute them! Oh, my God! He wants to kill me, too. Please help me!

I know you're capable of such a deed, for I've followed your steps for a while now. Well, I'll tell you where he is, but I am only a messenger, an intermediary between Mael Bresail's desires and those who execute them. Please do not hurt anyone in this monastery.

There is a place where Mael Bresail feels safe, but ironically it is where he is the weakest, as only a few men travel with him there. Mael Bresail's mother is not Goidelic, but a Briton from Cornubia. She was kidnapped by a war party of the Ui Neill many years ago and was made a wife by one of its leaders, the father of Mael Bresail.

When his father died, Mael Bresail went back to her homeland and built a house for his mother and a fort for himself, near Bosvenegh. He goes there when he needs to visit or to rest. After what happened recently, he will go there to seek comfort and advice from his old mother. Few know this. I only know because once I had to accompany him to cure his mother. If you find him, remember that Mael Bresail is a reasonable man. Accept what he proposes. Revenge is useless.
He tried to kill me. Only his death will stop me. Farewell.
I always listen if the proposal is interesting. Farewell.
That's all I need. Farewell.
Pater, is there anything I can do to help your monastery?
Perhaps. We are building more houses for our new brothers, and we definitely need more timber. Would you be able to bring us {reg33} pallets?
Nein, mein Sohn, wir benötigen deine Hilfe momentan nicht.
Vater, Sie können auf mich zählen!
Pater, I brought you {reg33} pallets of timber, as you requested.
Thank you, {playername}. The brothers of {s3} will be praying nightly for your soul. Amen.
Vater, ich fürchte dafür habe ich keine Zeit.
Pater, we need God to cleanse us of our sins. Here are 500 peningas for widows and orphans.
Ego absolvo te a peccatis tuis, in nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus Sanctii. Amen. Eure Männer werden sich nun besser fühlen.
Vater, ich würde gerne mehr über die Konvertierung zum einzig wahren Glauben erfahren.

Sure, my son. I will be more than happy to talk to you about the matters of Christianity, but I don't have a lot of free time. Would you consider a donation to our monastery? I think 500 peningas will help my brothers make this place even more beautiful.
Selbstverständlich, hier ist meine Spende.
Verzeihen Sie, ich habe nicht genug Geld dabei.
I really don't see why I should pay you. Good day!

Thank you, my {reg59?daughter:son}. Our Lord, Jesus Christ will be pleased. Now, about conversion. You see, each settlement has some mix of true Christians, pagans, heretics and, God forbid, atheists. Every day, events affect people's beliefs. Some turn to Christianity, and others abandon it. That effect is fairly insignificant, on balance, unless there is some kind of force that compels people to choose one way over the others. Certain lords and minor adventurers come with a sword and try to force people to change their beliefs. That, of course, is not God's way.

Our Lord, Jesus Christ, teaches us that any influence we exert on people should come through convincing, preaching and other non-violent means. However, force of threat produces results that are more spectacular, albeit short-lived. This can be improved by compelling people to build a house of worship and hiring a good priest to teach them. Initially, many people may not like that they are being forced to follow our God, but eventually, through God's Word, they change.

With persistence and patience, more and more people will turn to the only true faith, just as they have done elsewhere in Europe. The more people are converted, the easier it will be to convert the rest. But please be prepared for setbacks! Initially, it will be a difficult process. If too many people living in that particular place become too angry, they may even riot and burn down the house of worship. Even then, don't despair. Rebuild it and continue with your mission. Also, it helps if your settlement is near a monastery. God bless you, my {reg59?daughter:son}. I pray that your way will be blessed if you decide to follow this path. Amen.
Habt dank, Vater. Das war sehr lehrreich.
You mentioned forced conversion...

Yes, my {reg59?daughter:son}. Some of our more overzealous brothers, especially the ones who consider themselves to be great soldiers, think that chopping off a few heads will force people to abandon their beliefs in favor of Christianity. While it may work to some degree in the very short term, inevitably these people will reconvert to their old gods the moment the sword is back in its sheath. If this is the path that you wish to take, I advise that you have a dozen or so clergymen with you to facilitate the process.

Being formidable is important, but it is also essential to be able to speak intelligently and persuasively. Your personality will also play a role. Being bold and courageous should help your case, as opposed to being shy and compassionate. Lastly, I highly recommend that you build up relations with the people first. It is well known that people are more receptive if they trust and like you. May God help you, my {reg59?daughter:son}. Amen.
Vater, ich hörte großartiges über den Wein dieses Klosters. Darf ich ein paar Krüge kaufen?
Sorry, my {reg59?daughter:son}. We have just sold it to someone else.
Sehr gut. Ich möchte welche kaufen.
Actually, I prefer to talk about other things.
Nothing{reg0?, Pater:}. I must take my leave now.
{s2}^^Ho, Ho, Ho! Who's that tripping over my bridge? This troll wants some gold because you are on his bridge!
Ho, Ho, Ho! This troll wants some gold because you are on his bridge!
You're just a big, ugly fool, not a troll.
I will pay you 100 peningas.
Business on the other side of this bridge is not as pressing as I thought.
This troll is happy with his toll! Now you can continue on your way.
Ho, Ho, Ho! When I was little, my mother said to me, 'Grendel, my son, if someone calls you big, ugly or a fool, ignore him. But if someone calls you all three together, hit him.
{s2}^^I don't know who you are or what your name is. I don't care about your origin or your intentions. I just want to have some fun.
I like the sound of that! I'd like to have some fun! But what are you?
You appear to be deeply disturbed, go your own way. Farewell.
Oh no, you want to have fun, but you don't have enough money! Come back when you have twenty times a thousand silver coins, then we'll have some fun. Silver, gold, coins, jewels - I love them all...
Oh no, you want to have fun, but you don't have enough room for my awards?  Go sell something and come back when you have more space, and we'll have some fun.
Alright! Let the fun begin! The game has started. There shall be... a question for a riddle and a riddle for a question. If you fail, I take your silver, but if you succeed, you get a reward! Maybe.

My answer to your question: I'm from a nearby village. People hated me because I was thought to be the son of an elf, who bring bad luck. I had to flee, leaving my mother behind, and take refuge in here.^^Now it is my turn. Listen carefully to my riddle. If your answer is wrong, I'll take away some of your money, but if you answer correctly, I'll give you a reward. I want your money, I want your gold, I love silver and gold.
Who is that shrill one,^Who rides a hard road,^Despite going that way before?^He keeps old wood^Between his two cheeks^But pushes away good gold.
A cart.
A squirrel.
A hammer.
Me.
A bad singer.
That's not the correct answer. Your silver is mine. Let's have more fun!
Yes, the hammer is used for working gold. I love gold! A hammer shouts out loud when it hits the hard anvil, and that is its road. Take your prize, and let's continue.
What is that wonder^I saw in my ruins,^Eight feet it has^And four eyes^And knees above its belly.
An eight-foot stone pillar.
A spider.
A monster.
A flowering vine.
That's not the correct answer. Your silver is mine. Let's have more fun!

Yes, a spider is the correct answer, but that was an easy one. Way too easy, indeed, so you don't deserve a prize! I will take your gold this time, agreed? Yes, your gold is mine. The next riddle will be more difficult, I promise! And you will get your prize. Trust me!
Yes, right answer! Maybe this was too easy. Take your prize and let's continue.
You're a sneaky rat!
Well, let's continue.
No, no, I am not a rat! I am a good elf, but I love your silver so much, I can't help it. I will not cheat again, I promise! Listen to my next riddle.
Four hang.^Four sprang.^Two find the way.^Two ward off dogs.^One dangles after,^Always rather dirty.
Eine Kuh.
Swords.
A squad of swordsmen.
Spiders.
You are incorrect. Your silver is mine. One more riddle to go!
Yes, that has four feet and four udders, two horns and two eyes, and the tail dangles after. Take your prize, and let's continue on to the last riddle.

What creature is it that carries men?^It has a bloody back,^Yet shelters the strong^From shaft and point^And all manner of attack.^It gives life to some,^But itself lies down^Inside a soldier's grasp?
ein Schiff
ein Pferd
ein Schild
A wall.
A noose for hanging elves!
Incorrect! Your silver is mine!

Yes, a shield is often bloody from battle, defends well those men who know how to use it, but carries off the men that don't. Take your prize!^^This is the best of my prizes, an ancient helmet I found in the tomb of a king. This helmet is very valuable, so take care of it.
That was fun! I always played riddles with my mother before I had to flee my village. But this is my home now, and it's late and time for me to go back to my hidey-hole. Good luck! Farewell.
Talk to the captain, he is in charge here.
Talk to the captain, he is in charge here.
--She does not look you in the eye as she speaks to you.--
--He does not look you in the eye as he speaks to you.--
{s2}^^This is a trading post. Here we buy captured slaves and offer a better price than other sites. If you brought slaves to sell, talk. If not, leave.
Ich hab Gefangene zu verkaufen.
You're enslaving innocent people. I came to kill you.
Sorry for disturbing you. Farewell.
Well, well, you're a funny {reg59?lady:man}. Now I am going to kill you.

I will pay you according to the quality of the prisoner as do other slave traders and I will add 1 pening on top regardless of their status. That means you will earn one extra pening per slave more than you will anywhere else.
You don't appear to have any slaves to sell. Why are you wasting my time?
Meine Gefangenen gehören dir. Bezahlt mich
I don't want to sell. Farewell.
Nice doing business with you. Come back when you have more slaves for me.
{s2}^^Hey, hey, who are you and what are you doing in my hole?
I am {playername}, what are you hiding here?
Sorry for disturbing you. Farewell.

Well, well, you're a funny {reg59?lady:man} to poke your nose into other people's affairs. You know, I met a man like you once, a real goose... As an old god once said, I will answer all your questions if you solve but a single riddle of mine.
And what happened to that man?
Dafür hab ich keine Zeit. Lebt wohl.

That man had only one question to answer... can you imagine, a single question! but he failed and died before the divine. Now you must play this game. I'll ask you a riddle, and if you solve it, I'll answer all your questions, but if you fail, I'll take your soul.
I like riddles. Let's go.
Dafür hab ich keine Zeit. Lebt wohl.

Actually, I didn't say you have a choice. There is only one option, so let's play. Listen carefully, for your life is at stake, he-he. And the riddle is:^^I cannot be seen. I cannot be felt.^I cannot be heard. I cannot be smelt.^I lie behind stars and under the hills,^And holes, no matter how deep, I can always fill.^I always come first and always follow after.^I end all life. I kill all laughter.
Luft
Wolken
Tod
Finsternis
Wasser
Nichts.
I don't want to play.
That's not correct. Now you have a different problem that my friend and I will help to solve.

You're smarter than you look. Yes, it's darkness. Now, I will answer your questions. My pals and I are hiding treasure. Why? Because we are bandits and we stole it from a rich man. As you might have already guessed, this information is too valuable for you to live with, so your life will end now anyway.
Greetings to you, {reg59?madam:sir}. Welcome to our refuge. We are homeless and live under the protection of the old wall. You should talk to our leader.
Greetings to you, {reg59?madam:sir}. Welcome to our refuge. We are homeless and live under the protection of the old druid. You should talk to him.
Habt dank, lebt Wohl.
(He looks at you with eyes of hate.) Do you like sacrifices? Would you like to see these bastards kill a Saxon? Bah! Get lost!
Err... Farewell, then.

Welcome, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. I am a priest of the old gods. Do you know them? Certainly not. Men are forgetting them. Now they worship Christ. There were other gods in the land before the arrival of the Christians. I've read and heard the stories of our elders. I have restored their worship here.
Welcome, {playername}. I am the last druid.
I see. It is just an excuse to create your own sect.
What? I do not hurt anyone. People who want to come here are free to join us or leave. Why punish me with your presence?
Erzähl mir mehr über eure Götter.
You are mad! I see only evil here! This is a haven for murderers! Farewell.
I have no need for a man of any god at this time.

Our gods came largely from two families: the Children of Don and the Children of Llyr. Don was a goddess of the sky, and Llyr was a god of the sea. Don is known as the big mother. Among her children were the god Gwydion and the goddess Arianrod. Gwydion was a god druid, a 'master of illusion and fantasy.' He was a friend and helper of mankind, and a constant fighter against the powers of the underworld, the realm of Annwn.

Arianrod, called the 'Silver Circle,' bore two sons, Dylan and Lleu. Dylan had a great affinity for the sea, and swam as well as the best fish in the ocean. It is said that the waves of Britannia wept for Dylan at his death. Arianrod had poor bonds with her other son Lleu, and his care was left largely to Gwydion. Math, the brother of the goddess Don, was a master of magic and Gwydion's teacher of spells. Do you want to make a sacrifice to the old gods? I warn you that they are fickle.
I will donate 300 peningas for this temple and your refugees.
Thank you, your help is welcome. Our gods and goddesses are dying, and there is only one druid, me, who remembers them. More money is always welcome... and beautiful virgins too.
Take these 100 peningas and tell me more about them.
I really do not know anything else, the gods have sent me messages in dreams, and they say I must sacrifice slaves. They like blood, just like me!
I want to make a sacrifice. I will give you 4000 coins for the expenses of the ceremony.

Yes, yes, bring the money! Well, let me think... So far, I haven't had to do anything serious. I used to slay these wretched beggars and enjoy their screams.^^-The Druid summons his followers, and they surround you. They begin to chant in a language you don't understand. The Druid swings from side to side with a cruel smile and a huge knife in his hands.
-The Druid pronounces your name and opens the throat of a prisoner tied to the post with the ritual knife.^^You close your eyes...-
I want to sell you all prisoners I brought.
Do you have any pretty virgins? Anyways, I will pay you silver according to prisoner quality.
Eure Götter und Göttinnen werden zufrieden sein mit solch Opfergaben wie ich sie bringe.
Lasst mich noch einmal darüber nachdenken.

I'll tell you one thing: we are not here by chance. We are near the ancient Kingdom of Dyfed, a territory connected with Annwn, the Underworld.
